Reviews.Title: “Best thing: Close to St. Pancras”
Reviews.Author: SDTrav12
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel primarily because of its proximity to St. Pancras...we were catching the early Eurostar and this was one of the most convenient locations. The room was clean/bathroom was clean, but both were pretty bare-bones. Not an especially attractive location or view and the closeness to the trains and area bars meant there was some noise...but, honestly, we were jet-lagged and so the noise didn't actually bother us at all. We slept fairly well, and had no problems walking the 2 or so blocks to the station with our luggage. Not a luxury stay, but it served our purposes.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, clean room.”
Reviews.Author: Glasgowgal1
Reviews.Content: When we arrived at the hotel there were a group of people checking in, they were being offered basement rooms without a window. Immediately we were concerned. We used the self check in facility and were allocated a basement room. Due to the group still being dealt with by reception we decided to check out the room before asking for a swap. Much to our surprise when we went into the basement room we had a window. It was bright, clean and spacious enough for us. The room was to the front of the hotel so we did have some traffic noise but realistically in central London we didn't expect anything else. The hotel is a minutes walk from Kings Cross Rail and Underground station, which means the world is your oyster. We didn't spend long in the hotel - preferring to be out sightseeing and our only complaint is the wait at reception. There didn't seem to be staff on duty there so we had a bit of a wait each time we went to the desk.

Reviews.Title: “Average hotel close to Station”
Reviews.Author: nomad401
Reviews.Content: If you need to stay near the international train station St Pancras while in London and can't afford one of the 4 or 5 star hotels then the Travel lodge is an ok choice. I stayed here for 2 nights in a family room - which is a bit bigger than the double but oddly the same price at around 128pounds/night - and found it comfortable but no great. The beds are spring beds so not great if you have back problems or for more than 1 person. The family room also contains a pull out sofa, tv with a good variety of channels, kettle & coffee/tea and a small but very useable bathroom (note the shower pressure is very good here, not always the case in London 3 star hotels). You can also purchase wifi at 10pounds a day or 20/week. There is a nice bar in this hotel where they also serve a good breakfast for an additional charge. Lastly note that the Kings Cross area in London is very busy/loud so if you are a light sleeper it is best to avoid staying in this area altogether, my room overlooked the train line which was noisy all night, closing the window (which are double glazed) did cut out a lot of that noise, however I could still here the bass vibrations from nearby nighclubs.

Reviews.Title: “Get what you pay for”
Reviews.Author: p00kie87
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with a friend for one night and it was fine for that kind of stay. The room was quite small but cosy, bathroom was fine and clean and the bed was comfy. The only slight problem I can think of is we got stuck with a room facing the busy road on the first floor and despite the double glazing we could still here the traffic all night long. We were also woken at 5:30am by a strange noise in the hotel. But for £70 for one night it was great for what we needed and also a good location for where we needed to go.

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: Dann24
Reviews.Content: After reading all the review on this hotel I wasnt looking forward to my stay here I was given a room on the top floor overlooking the railways every few minutes u had a train going past this was until about 12.30am and then started again at 5.30am so didn't get much sleep it's in a good location just 5 min walk to st pancras station but overall I would not stay here again

Reviews.Title: “Good base for business and tourists”
Reviews.Author: luvtogo6
Reviews.Content: The building is beautiful, the small bar is an echo of how it once looked. The recpetion is functional and helpful. Rooms, as with most Travelodges, are clean and functional. Mine was over a rail line but this stopped over night and did not bother me at all. Location is great for business and tourists and transport links are excellent from there.

Reviews.Title: “Best Travelodge I've stayed in!”
Reviews.Author: HEm88
Reviews.Content: After reading some of the reviews on here I was a bit dubious about my stay at this hotel. However I was pleasantly surprised. The location is great for Kings Cross and St Pancras, with easy access to the tube for getting around London (it's about a 15 minute tube ride to Leicester Square). There's not much to do in the area but nearby are McDonalds, Starbucks, Subway, Tesco etc, perfect for a snack. The room was spotless. Ours was overlooking a courtyard area in the middle of the hotel so we weren't disturbed by any tube or travel noise (which to be fair you expect in central London anyway, especially if you book a Travelodge so close to the railway!!). There's a bar on the first floor which is open til 5am, however we went in there at about midnight after an evening out and were the only people there. If you're concerned about noise from the bar, ask to be on a different floor (we were 2nd floor). The bed was very comfy, only small problem was that it was very warm - as with all these places, the windows only open a tiny bit so it can get a bit stuffy. Plenty of towels were provided. There was some noise of people passing by in the corridor on their way back from nights out, but this didn't last long and was expected as we stayed on Friday/Saturday nights - it's probably even quieter in midweek. Check in was very quick as when we got there, there was no queue. Staff were very helpful - the man on reception put me and my friends in opposite rooms although we hadn't booked together so hadn't expected to get rooms close by! So that was a bonus. My friends' room was overlooking the tube but they said the noise wasn't too bad at all, it didn't disturb their sleep and as I said before it's what you expect when you book next to one of the busiest train stations in London! Would definitely stay here again, you'd struggle to find such good quality for as low a price.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and Compfy”
Reviews.Author: Lukearoundtheworld
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel last year prior to visiting Disneyland so location wise this hotel could not have been better. The staff here where very helpfull, I rang up on the day to arrange a late check in and this was no trouble at all. The night we stayed here we went out for a walk and too find some food, the choice is great theres a Macdonalds down the road and a subway opposite and a supermarket just round the corner. The only reason I have only given 3 stars is the fact that the hotel is very noisy, the room we had faced the street and although I had fun people watching it got loud at night (police sirens in London run all night) and there was a fight on the street outside. The only other negative comment is that we waited 15 mins in the bar before someone turned up to serve us although when he did he was appologetic. In all the hotel is clean, comfortable and made us feel welcome and if I am travelling via St. Pancras in the future I will be staying again.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible, noisy "hotel", but you get what you pay for!!!!”
Reviews.Author: 604green
Reviews.Content: Window was right over the tube line, with a noisy train passing every 2 minutes until 12.30am, even with the window closed. Nightclub located beside hotel, loud music and shouting until 3am. Finally got to sleep about 3.30am, tube started running again at 6am. Terrible experience, the couldn't care less attitude of the staff who informed me at about midnight when I went to complain that he can't stop the tube running or ask the club to turn the music off, and I should have read the website before I booked. True it does mention because of the location, you might be disturbed by some traffic and train noise, no mention of how bad that noise is or the night club noise outside the window until 3am. Stayed with wife and young son who couldn't sleep, BUT I only paid Â£70 for the night so wasn't expecting the Savoy, but a basic night sleep wasn' t too much to ask was it? There are obviously other rooms in this place that don't have the noise problem, but it's not worth the risk of being shoved in one of those rooms. Stay somewhere else, pay the little bit extra and stay at the Premier Travel Inn doen the road.

Reviews.Title: “Travelodge no longer a "Safe bet"”
Reviews.Author: DevonHare
Reviews.Content: Gave this 2 stars only because I'm sure I've stayed in worse places. Fortunately we did not have the rail noises others have commented on, but..... a) room was not made up after first night and had to get towels after it having been suggested that maybe it wa sour fault for having the do not disturn sign outside the room. Hmmmm I'm sure i would have remembered that! b) the bathroom extractor was continually running, and seemed to be a system that vented to a (large) central extraction fan. Being near the top of the building, the fan pulls more severely tahn at lower levels,; as a result you could really hear it all the time, esp after your ears have "tuned in" to it at 2am..... result..... no sleep c) soundinsulation between rooms virtually non existent, and creaking floorsd means that all footsteps can be heard. No silent doorclosers so all doors slam shut. I'd hate to be tehre Friday and Saturday nights when the bar is open until around 4am.... d)..... hardly the good night's sleep in the cdity they promise! e) double glazing draughty and definitely not soundproof (by a long shot) f) breakfast just about adequate but breakfast room too small resultimng in staff and guests falling over each other, not helped by bad layout g) picture frame in room literally falling apart! No pride at all. Travelodge used to be a safe bet, you knew what to expect at the budget end. That ethos seems to have disappeared.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and Tidy”
Reviews.Author: tictraveller
Reviews.Content: we stayed here for two nights in a family room. Initially we had to ask for more bedding and towels as there was only enough for 3 people (4 of us staying). This was supplied and brought to our room. Although our room was quite small and basically furnished, it was clean and tidy enough the hotel is closely located to the train and tube station, however as a result of this the room we had was extremely noisy. It actually felt as though the window had been left open. Coupled with the soft bed and sirens going all night we did not get a great deal of sleep. The room was serviced and however the pressure in the shower was wholly inadequate and made getting a shower quite difficult. The breakfast was fine, everything there that you would expect. Basicall for this hotel, we got what we paid for.

Reviews.Title: “worst 'budget' hotel”
Reviews.Author: juliegalloway
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in Oct. 2011 for 2 nights and will never return again. Good for location, but that's it. Rooms tatty, beds uncomfortable and very noisy at night (with the window closed). I even woke up in the middle of the night with buzzing in my ear which wouldn't stop. I ended up putting water in my ear to stop it and when I returned home the next day cleaned my ear with a cotton bud. There was a small flea type thing there!! Premier Inns are far superior for round about the same price.

Reviews.Title: “dirty!”
Reviews.Author: F1ossy
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 2 nights. thank goodness we paid the sale rate rather than full price. couldnt fault the handy location but the hotel room needed a good refurbishment. I tried not to look too closely but couldnt avoid the stains on the walls, plaster over the smoke alarm, broken side light, dirty surfaces which even included a cigarette from the previous resident (despite being a non smoking room), unhoovered carpet, hairs in the bathroom. The bed was as soft as a waterbed it was that worn out. We had to share a towel between two as they just provided one for our stay. The corridor stunk of cigarette smoke too-always in the morning. Breakfast wasnt great-the crossiants could have been used in the recent riots as ammo they were that hard. None of the food was covered and left out for hours. A better bet would be starbucks or macdonalds around the corner. Finally the staff were that miserable it was comical. If you fancy a 'dirty weekend' at travelodge-stay here-and bring your rubber gloves!!

Reviews.Title: “Bad Service”
Reviews.Author: Paul H
Reviews.Content: The family and I went to see Shrek the musical ( fantastic ) we had the master plan of getting the fast train from Ebbslfeet to St Pancras then 5 min walk to hotel, that way we havent got to put a 7 & 5 year old back on the train at 11 at night. Good deal Â£55.00 for family room and then the fun started!! - Window broken causing draft to whistle to floor not normally and issue but the "family room " consisted of a double bed and a sofa with a pull out matress on the floor. Cue the other residents, jumping around running up and down hall ways until 5 am. We checked out at 7am without any sleep for the wife and I thankfully the kids got some. Explained to reception "why didnt you ring to complain it is 24 hrs you know" if i did that then I would of awoken the children. I then completed a survey form detailing the issue and to this day nobody at Travelodge head office or Kings Cross can be bothered. Obvioulsy we were unlucky at that particular night with the other residents but the back up and service is still shocking.

Reviews.Title: “Take earplugs, great location but needs a good clean”
Reviews.Author: sarahladyjane
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 2 nights whilst visiting a trade show in london. Positives: Great location- 1 minute walk to euro star- so surely you expect some noise from the station? Front of desk- extremely helpful and changed our room from double to family with no problems and a great attitude. Downsides: Dirt and mould in room Shower needed sealing Sofa bed soft furnishing ripped Noisy I must say you get what you pay for, but I do expect travel lodge to up their game whenit comes to room cleanliness- this is not down to the cleaners, it needs managements attention.

Reviews.Title: “Usually great hotel was a let down.”
Reviews.Author: ShannaCK
Reviews.Content: I stay at this hotel on regular trips to London and usually find it cannot be beaten for price and location. I have just finished a three week trip through the UK and was this time dissapointed with the hotel. We received a great deal and a room was well sized and comfortable. The service however was a let down. We noticed on the first night that the heating system and the shower were not working. We reported this to staff who advised they would get ut seen to ASAP. This never happened and despite constant requests and reminders about the issues nothing was ever fixed. In the middle of the stay I complained to staff that nothing had been fixed and we were freezing cold at night. We were offered extra blankets but the heating remained broken for the rest of our stay. Our shower continued to flood and shoot water all over the bathroom for the entire trip. On the bright side the location cannot be beaten and the hotel is very secure with card entry to practically every door. The service was a let down to a usually great hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A gem of a hotel in Central London!!!”
Reviews.Author: DeniseBranfoot
Reviews.Content: Was mildly concerned after seeing some reviews on here and wasn't sure what to expect but we got a great price cos we booked in advance. This was just for 1 night and was less than 2 mins walk from Kings Cross Station - location perfect!! Hotel was very clean, much more secure than I had expected requiring door keys to even get through the door to get to the lift, again you need your room key card just to get through any door in the hotel. This made me feel much more secure - as we were a group of women staying there. We booked 3 rooms. Great Cafe across the road: Cafe Plaka - fabulous! Go there to eat if you are looking for a great cooked breakfast or sandwich :) Enjoy your trip to London. I would most definitely stay there again, for sure! Even if I took my young kids. From some rooms you could hear the trains go by occasionally but it never bothered us.

Reviews.Title: “Good for one night”
Reviews.Author: Divabiz
Reviews.Content: I stayed here one night on the 14th January. The hotel has a nice exterior & is in a central location (it is a 5 min walk from Kings Cross/St Pancras). If you get directions before you go like I did, you will find it really simple to find. I did call early to request a quiet room on an upper floor & that is what I got. I was on the 5th floor (the lift only goes to the 4th floor so you have to climb 2 sets of stairs to get to 5th floor through narrow hallways). It was a quiet & very spacious room however compared to other hotel rooms I have stayed in. The room was clean...the batteries in the remote were not working but the tv was good. The heating was good. A little too warm even. Bed was big & comfy...a little on the soft side. The reception staff didn't have the best english language skills but were still friendly. The front door is closed & there is no one at reception at 6am when I had to leave so just left the key card on the counter & pressed the exit button to leave the building. There is a McDonalds, Subway, Fish & Chip, Kebab, Grocery Stores & many takeaways & restaurants around in the street across from the hotel. Overall, not bad. I don't know if I would stay any longer that a day or two but for a cheap price (I got a 12 pound deal!)...was quite decent.

Reviews.Title: “BASIC BASE. EXCELLENT FOR CENTRAL LONDON.”
Reviews.Author: NICHOLAS042
Reviews.Content: Have just arrived home after a long weekend staying at the Kings Cross Travelodge in London. There are 2 others nearby, Kings Cross Royal Scot and Farringdon but this is the best out of the lot. My 3 night stay only cost me Â£67 as I booked saver rooms 9 months ago. My purpose was to catch a couple of shows in the West End and explore the East End and City of London. Stayed at Room 510. All amenities there. Colour TV, comfy double bed, shower, tea and coffee making facilities aswell. Being on the top floor couldn't hear much noise from the rest of the hotel. Yes, you do hear the odd siren from the main road but generally quiet. Flush on the chain was a bit dodgy, one electric plug didn't work and there was one light bulb that had gone in the fixtures but it didn't bother me. Hotel only does continental breakfast for a further Â£5.40 charge but so many other places around to eat, independent cafes aswell as the usual McDonalds, Starbucks and Burger King. Tube and bus into Central London takes 15-20 mins. Excellent tube and bus links aswell. Run all night. So convenient to get out early, go into London to do what you want to do, then back to the hotel to shower and change before going back into the centre for evening meal and drinks, etc. It's not the Hilton but clean, basic and the staff are polite and helpful at all times.

Reviews.Title: “nice exterior...... shame about the rooms”
Reviews.Author: Jonnyoftheboy
Reviews.Content: Travelodge really are going downhill! they need to spend a little bit of money on their hotels and rooms as they are being left behind by the standard of premier inns IMO. this one has a nice exterior, decent bit of character in the bar, but the rooms are dreadful, as they are in all the other Traveldoges I have stayed in over the past 12 months - Battersea, Dartford, etc..... awful! For Â£100-odd, you expect more. UP YOUR GAME TRAVELODGE!!!

Reviews.Title: “loved it”
Reviews.Author: shazzafee
Reviews.Content: At Â£29 a night for a family of 4 we where not expecting much. We where pleasently suprised. It was close to the station and underground and shops, but yet we heard no outside noise at all. The staff where very helpful and friendly. I would certinaly stay here again

Reviews.Title: “Balance the stories”
Reviews.Author: TGG84
Reviews.Content: I managed to book this hotel for 6 nights on a Travelodge sale day,so paid small amount of money. I then read some reviews and I became very concerned, but always check it out myself. This Travelodge has 2 sides, one of which is a "quiet side".I rang the Traveodge the day before my visit to request a "quiet side" room. Very pleasant staff who actioned my request. On arrival I double checked the request had been actioned to which i was told yes. My room is sunny and bright. I have a window for light and ventilation. I have a working heater. All other aspects of my room are standard Travelodge, all clean with no issues. Doors are slightly noisey but safe and secure. On balance I would recommend this Travelodge. Great location for all parts of London.

Reviews.Title: “This isn't just budget - it's rubbish budget”
Reviews.Author: askmeimight
Reviews.Content: I know Travelodge is budget and I have never stayed in a really good one ever. But this was a new low. The corridor security door was broken, the room was dank and dark. Two chairs outside the room looked like they had been dragged in from a skip, the sofa in the room wasn't much better although it was difficult to tell as the light in the entry to the room was not working so it was too dark to see anything properly. This was offset by the weird blue glow which came through the (non opening) window even with the curtains closed. The tv was an antique without remote control and wasn't working (although fixed when reported - no remote tho. The room needed a proper clean and the bed squeaked at the slightest movement. The corridor outside the room smelt damp and frankly horrible. Even at the special sale rate I felt robbed. I don't think I would have felt any better if they had paid me! Wont be going back.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value, Convenient Location, Friendly Staff.”
Reviews.Author: FreeSprit62
Reviews.Content: After receiving a super low price on the Internet we checked into this hotel on a Monday afternoon. It is located 5-10 minutes walk from Kings Cross Station on a busy street where there are several cafes and convenience shops.The staff was friendly and we asked for a quiet room as we understood that some of the rooms had noise from the trains. I was assigned a third floor room with double glazing. There was no problem with train noise. The room was clean and spacious. There is coffee and tea in the room. We paid for continental breakfast on the Internet and it was the usual fare which was satisfactory. There was some noise from a few late night revelers however it was no different than you can find in more expensive hotels. Very pleased with this hotel and will look for a similar deal in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for Girlie Weekend”
Reviews.Author: JeannyB1509
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel in December 2011 to accommodate 4 ladies for 3 nights. The hotel looks lovely from the outside, The reception area has a hot drinks machine and a snack vending machine. There are a few internet access machines too. The reception staff were very helpful, friendly and welcoming. There is a bar on the first floor but the bar tender was not very pleasant and never smiled at all - didn't stay long as there was no atmosphere. Rooms - were spotless and the beds were fine. There was 1 double bed, a bed settee and a pull out bed which was stored under the bed settee. Tea & coffee making facilities. Security was great - You need a room key to access the lift, your floor & your room - no key no access Noice -The rooms were very warm & we slept with the window open the first night - we thought we were sleeping on the platform! Kept the windows shut next couple of nights - no noice to speak of really. Nearby - there are lovely restaurants serving great breakfasts and varied meals e.g. italian ?Indian, Chinese, Spanish etc. 3 minute walk to King's Cross Station & 5 minute walk to Pancras station

Reviews.Title: “all u need”
Reviews.Author: EnglandPrincesssara
Reviews.Content: Good times if your going out in london close to everything, clean enough, all u need really its a travellodge so ur not expecting luxury. Always go for mad girl wkend but if i were goin on a romantic wkend with my boyf def would go elsewhere as its just basic. You get what you pay for.

Reviews.Title: “great value for a family”
Reviews.Author: jan s
Reviews.Content: We were worried by the reviews which seemed to vary from 'excellent' to 'rathole'. We were therefore relieved that it met our personal expectations - a clean, spacious enough family room on the 4th floor so no noise from trains and double-glazing shut out traffic sound. Friendly staff. Easy location to commute to various parts of London from. We spent more on meals out than the nightly room rate cost us - so great value and makes a London trip more affordable overall for us now country bumpkins who once lived in London.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient for Kings Cross”
Reviews.Author: Alecko
Reviews.Content: Most Travelodges tend to be similar (if not identical), but this one is very conveniently located for Kings Cross/St Pancras station and provides decent facilities at a reasonable price for central London. The staff were friendly and professional and the hotel facilities were ideal for a one-night stay. There was a minor glitch with keycards malfunctioning, but the receptionist sorted it out immediately. The room was small, very clean and functional, and the bed was very comfortable. The buffet breakfast was good and served in an attractive, high ceilinged formal room overlooking the busy junction at Kings Cross. There was a wide choice of food, including hot croissants, fresh fruits and the usual range of cereals. Even the fresh coffee was pretty good. Yes, there is some background noise at night, but then the hotel does advertise itself as being next to Kings Cross station, so to be honest I think that is to be expected. If you need silence to sleep, then best to look elsewhere. On the other hand, if you are looking for a reasonably priced hotel within sight of Kings Cross or St Pancras, then this is probably one of the best options.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: rebecca l
Reviews.Content: Not bad for a cheap way to stay in london with a family of four on a budget and very central connecting to all parts of London. Try and request a quieter room as trains start at five and it is noisy!! Unluckily the fire alarm went off at 1am and we were all evacuated from the hotel and not really informed of what was happening..apart from that, we enjoyed our stay and would recommend to use as a base. Good breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Better than I thought”
Reviews.Author: Markgracey
Reviews.Content: Room only cost Â£70 so wasn't expecting much particularly as reviews were mixed, but had to keep cost low. But was pleasantly surprised by the state of the hotel. The room is clean and bed linen seems ok. Tv didn't work (only fuzzy CH5) and toilet could have Ben cleaner, but it will do. Oh yea - there's a lot of traffic and train noise - it sounds as though the window s not shut, but it is!

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money”
Reviews.Author: djdm62
Reviews.Content: My daughter & I have just returned from a 2 night stay in London.We found the hotel convenient , clean & tidy.Not 5 star, but you get what you pay for..would definitely use this hotel again

Reviews.Title: “More Positive Than Negative!”
Reviews.Author: spencerspider
Reviews.Content: As stated previously the photo is not the correct one for this hotel. Spent 3 nights, 2 adults & 2 children (14&7). Like others said the hotel is very close to a train track but there is a clue in the fact that this hotel is at kings cross and the map does show how close. The area is busy on a whole, it has major train & tube stations. Our room was directly next to the track and either we all sleep like logs or the trains do stop over night... more annoying were other quests who were rather noisy during the late/early hours. The family room was of a decent size, bathroom was small but was absolutley fine & fit for use... shower was nice! Breakfast was good too, 2 adults and kids ate free. Good choice of foods (cereals, toast, yoghurts, pastries, teas, coffee, juices) and the staff in the bar/cafe were lovely, we started each day nicely full.

Reviews.Title: “worst travelodge I have ever stayed in”
Reviews.Author: Cheryl K
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in quite a few travelodges over the years but this really had to be the worst of the bunch. The staff were rude to us on check in, our room overlooked the train track with trains going past every few minutes (very noisy), the shower had hardly any pressure and to top it off the bed was the most uncomfortable we had ever slept in. We had to be at Kings Cross at 6.30am the next morning for the Eurostar and thanks to travelodge we ached all over and were tired from hardly any sleep.

Reviews.Title: “Tired and Old”
Reviews.Author: partyprincess33
Reviews.Content: We stayed here sept 2011 for 3 nights. Very basic and grotty marks all over walls and sticky carpets. We stayed at the back of the building overlooking the car park which was very noisy all night.

Reviews.Title: “Third degree over a hairdryer”
Reviews.Author: Steaklover42
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this Travelodge before with no complaints, although the photo depicting the hotel is not the right one this is of the Royal Scott. On this visit I was allocated a room directly next to the train track, so as previous posters have said it can be noisy, the times I have stayed before I must have had a back room as I have never heard the trains. On check in I remembered to ask for a hair dryer as they are kept at reception, only to be asked if I intended to use it that night, I replied that no, it was for the morning, so I was then asked what time in the morning? What is this the third degree!! Anyway I was eventually told I could pick one up later that night, which I did, but anyone would think you were being handed the crown jewels, not a tiny rubbish hairdryer, which would have cost no more than Â£5, I would have willingly handed a Â£5 over as a deposit rather then the inquisition I got for asking for it too early, before I left reception I was asked to bring it back immediately after I had finished with it and what time would I think this would likely to be. On my departure I was asked if I had enjoyed my stay, I replied that it was very noisy but all I got back was a shrug. Good base if you don't intend actually staying in the room for long, but for anything else don't bother.

Reviews.Title: “Would never go back if you paid me”
Reviews.Author: roisine w
Reviews.Content: Ok so we arrived at hotel - check in was ok - reception staff a little bit offish - went up into our room which had a dirty steal smell to it - shower had no pressure just dripping - sink was dirty and water wouldnt go down! Come back in from a gresat night out to be greeted by sercurity saying out smoke alarms were going out, kicked us out because they said we were smoking in room! which we were not! all 3 of us are non smokers!!!!! had no where to go in the middle of the night. AWFUL! i am now taking things further and to be told that they were taking personal pictures of us in our room!

Reviews.Title: “Worst hotel we've ever stayed in!!”
Reviews.Author: Siany91
Reviews.Content: We booked a double room at the cost of Â£70. Having stayed at a travelodge before (in Lowestoft) we weren't expecting much, but this was diabolical!!!! Firstly every single wall in the room was marked with either fingerprints, scratches or food stains. The carpet was out of date and marked. The tv was situated so you couldnâ€™t even watch it from bed and the signal made it just about watchable. The chair provided was ripped at the bottom and torn around the top. Thick layers of BLACK dust were around the skirting. For a non smoking room we started to get the distinct smell of cigarette smoke. The shower constantly dripped and water started to spread along the bathroom floor towards the door. One of the buttons had come off the shower so was difficult to use. There was no window as such as about a metre away from the window was a sheet of plastic stopping you from getting any fresh air. There were 2 plug sockets but only one working. The restaurant was overpriced and i got served a micro waved lasagne at Â£6.95 and a slice of cold garlic bread. When trying to use the lift (which smelt of urine) the doors jammed so we had to go back to the groundfloor and use the stairs. Topped off that we were kept awake the majority of the night by something that sounded like a hoover. Wouldn't recommend to anyone!

Reviews.Title: “Cheap and not cheerful”
Reviews.Author: Ben L
Reviews.Content: Very dated hotel in King Cross. Even though its a Travelodge with cheap room available, but the place is dirty and noisy (not from traffic outside, but other young kids staying for the London field trip from other European countries. Its 5 mins walk from King Cross and 15mins from Euston, this provide easy access to the City.

Reviews.Title: “Don't know what everyone is moaning about!”
Reviews.Author: bagey5
Reviews.Content: Great location, yes bit noisy but your in the middle of kings cross for goodness sake. Couldn't fault the room or the beds, all very comfy. Stayed here with two children so the keycard thing made me feel safe and secure. Staff all really friendly and helpful. If people want a quiet luxurious nights sleep then pay quiet, luxurious prices and go somewhere else instead of moaning about chipped wallpaper etc. Your only sleeping here not moving in!

Reviews.Title: “Needs smartening up”
Reviews.Author: AlisonJW
Reviews.Content: I stay in Travelodges a lot and have used this one before. The room I had this time could have been lovely - on a corner with windows on two sides, and big with a comfy bed. But it smelt a bit stale (cigarette smoke?) and had the general feeling of not having been used for a while. The TV had the ariel pulled out and there was no kettle. But the bathroom was the main problem - it was scruffy with horribly dirty grouting, missing shelves and no sink plug. The first key card I was given didn't work, and I had to go back to reception twice before I got a kettle.

Reviews.Title: “Noisy, smelly, very very basic and not the cleanest.”
Reviews.Author: RotherLad
Reviews.Content: This hotel lives only by its location. Stayed twice on business. Both rooms basic. One clean-ish, one mucky carpets. Over-riding smell of cheap air-freshener. Far too warm, no air con. One room I had was quiet-ish - road noise, the other over the underground (outside) lines. Not much sleep at all in the latter apart from the few trainless hours in the night. There is a bar. Over priced and definitely not hotel standard - stayed in much better hostels.

Reviews.Title: “Like many have said before - avoid”
Reviews.Author: MatthewAppleton
Reviews.Content: Put simpley the room was horrid, paint pealing from the walls, mucky carpet, no paintings, uncomfortable bed. Equally, not that this is the hotel's fault, but the noise from the railway station and the main junction of GRAYS INN ROAD and EUSTON ROAD means that if you're not out of bed by 0700hrs then you will be! Suggest staying in something a little further away.

Reviews.Title: “Don't be put off by the other reviews”
Reviews.Author: jray2436
Reviews.Content: I was a little weary about choosing this hotel because of the previous reviews and perhaps I was in a lucky room on a quiet day but I was rather pleased with my stay Staying down in London for one night I required a hotel that was close to Kings Cross [literally five minutes away] and the underground and for ease of access to the public transport systems this hotel ranks very highly. I'd choose this hotel over my last stay in the Travelodge at Marylebone. Checking in was easy through using their computer check in system [I also paid the extra Â£10 to check in early - merely to dump my bags and get shopping] , yet there was a manned reception if people prefer the more people oriented way - the staff I did meet when checking out where very friendly. You do need to keep your room pass on you at all times to get through to the floors and to use the lifts. The room itself (I was booked into 114) which was away from the train station side of the hotel was nice a large, airy and came with everything you expected. The bed was lovely and soft [i've stayed in some hotels with very hard beds] the tv sound however was stuck on one level [not sure if that it was meant to be that way or it was the tv] and the radiator didn't seem to work. However the hotel seems to be very warm anyway so that wasn't too much of a problem. Yes you could hear the odd train honking in the distance and you could hear them rumble but the website does state your staying right by both a road and train line. i do wish more city centre hotels offered a left baggage or storage facility however there is a place provided at Kings Cross for Â£8.50 per bag per 24 hours. I would definitely stay here again, for the proximity to the Kings Cross line it can't be beaten.

Reviews.Title: “very handy for kings cross/st pancras stations”
Reviews.Author: BOBHAM5114
Reviews.Content: We chose this travelodge primarily for its location as we were catching the eurostar in the morning and secondly we got it for around Â£40. It is only 100 yds from kings cross so that was good as we didnt arrive until 9pm.Its situated in a lovely building and not the one in the photograph. It was a sunday night we stayed and all was quiet when we stayed so that is all i can report on, we didnt have breakfast due to previous bad travelodge breakfasts. The room was average type travelodge room ,small with extremely small old tv, overall, i would recommend this hotel for a short stay

Reviews.Title: “Ideal overnight rest by Eurostar Station”
Reviews.Author: DescerningTraveller
Reviews.Content: Good over night place, clean and cheap, only 10 minutes away from St Pancras

Reviews.Title: “Great for the train - that's about it”
Reviews.Author: gingerluci
Reviews.Content: We had an early train from St Pancras so stayed the night before. It was perfectly conveinient, walking distance with wheely bags - restaurants near by (Nandos) so could get some late night food. The bed was uncomfortable, TV tiny and room pokey - but it was clean and did the job. I would have cried if I was staying here any longer than a night! The rooms were noisy due to outside road noise -despite it being a hot night we had the windows closed which did provide some shelter from the night traffic. We both had horrible nights sleep, but I don't know if that was more the anticipation of getting up in the morning rather than the room itself. For a Eurostar quick stay it is perfect & cheaper (Â£75) than the premier inn (Â£145) so really depends on your priorities. The room is clean and does the job - but it certainly isn't somewhere you'd want to stay on your main holiday of the year of weekend break! It's definitely priced for London.

Reviews.Title: “Central for tourists”
Reviews.Author: GaryTemple
Reviews.Content: Close to Train and Underground station so when you arrive and leave you just wander over the road is you are using British Rail Kings Cross for your journey. Its a travel lodge and I have stayed there twice, Better experience in rooms on the front as they are fairly quiet but at the back you have the underground trains coming and going into the tunnels from 5.30 am. So try to specify front. Other than that good experience.

Reviews.Title: “DO NOT GO HERE”
Reviews.Author: ainshlie
Reviews.Content: This hotel was absolutely disgusting. Dirty rooms, cigarette butts on the floor, noisy, Windows didn't open, rude staff and the list goes on. I wrote to travelodge several times about what an awful two nights we had spent at this hotel and never got a reply. I strongly advise you stay as far away from this place as possible!!!

Reviews.Title: “trains airless not good”
Reviews.Author: daffdave
Reviews.Content: first the picture shown is not the right travel lodge grays inn road is an old building the room was ok after lift then going along loads of coredoors the train noise was bad one every 30 seconds at peak times the tv was very old remote was all stuck toughether with tape no channel 4 no phone in room so no early call avalable breakfast is described as contenental no way the only bread was sliced white or sliced brown the offerings were mainly sweet i am diabetic there were danish pastrys jam honey nuttela none of which i could have the juice apple and orange came from a vending machine so would have sugar added the coffee it was not good there was tinned orange and grapefruit segments but they had added sugar so contenental breakfast sliced bread and a cheese portion with crap coffee oh and dont arrive before 15.00 as if you want a room before that its an extra Â£10 my advise satay away if you must use this hotel eat out lots of great looking breakfasts across the road no eavning meal avalable any way

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money and excellent location!”
Reviews.Author: LinaM89
Reviews.Content: We arrived on the Thursday and there was a few people at reception so we used the quick check in machines that are really good. Took us around 2 minutes to get our room number and key. Went up to the room and it was lovely. It was clean and tidy and the obvious things such as tea and coffee. It was really noisy but we were expecting it and it does clearly say on the website: "Due to the proximity of the hotel...some guests may experience Rail and Traffic noise. We apologise for any inconvenience this may cause." I understand people complaining about the heat. We did have a fan in the room which did help but we did have to have the window open most of the time. Location wise it's about 2 minutes from Kings Cross station, VERY handy for anywhere in London. All-in-all I'd definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Good price and a good nights sleep”
Reviews.Author: johnie e
Reviews.Content: Plus Points: Right by KX Station Minus Points: Dull Summary: Good nights sleep in a safe room. No views as in a basement but for the price I paid it was good

Reviews.Title: “Great location, very clean - air con would be nice.”
Reviews.Author: Andy M
Reviews.Content: Stayed three nights over a weekend, in room 3 in the basement with a window on the Grays Inn road. No traffic noise with the windows closed, so no problem sleeping. Although cooler temperatures at night probably helped, as I would imagine it would be really hot and stuffy in the summer, because you can't have the windows open with the traffic noise. The room was very clean with plenty of room for two adults and 2 children, 10 and 8. A two minute walk from St. Pancras mainline & Kings Cross tube stations, which is never more than a few stops from all the tourist attractions. Would definitely stay here again, but maybe not in high summer due to lack of air con. Incidentally - the picture at the top is of the wrong hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Very Handy for Eurostar”
Reviews.Author: Andrew T
Reviews.Content: We have used this hotel three times now, Twice this July before and after a continental holiday. As with all travelodges we have used, the rooms were basic but spotlessly clean and the beds were comfortable. There was a continental breakfast available with a reasonable choice of eats and a bar which opens till late. There is a downside, however, on our homeward trip, we stayed on a Saturday night. Our room was at the rear and overlooked the Thameslink Station so beware of train noise. Not a problem this stay but plenty of loud music and noise from the adjacent night club which carried on till two in the morning! Previous stays at this hotel were in rooms in the middle overlooking a central quadrangle. These are the best rooms as there is little outside noise. The staff were very efficient and polite during our visits. A very handy hotel, less than ten minutes walk from St Pancras International Station. Less for Kings Cross, Thameslink and the Underground. We will definately use it again.

Reviews.Title: “Good value hotel”
Reviews.Author: Adele C
Reviews.Content: We used this hotel with our two girls as a base for a couple of days sight seeing. Its good value for money and very clean with friendly staff. The trains can be a little noisy but we were so tired it didn't bother us at all

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for (not much)”
Reviews.Author: L C
Reviews.Content: Staff were friendly that was the best thing. The noise from inside and outside was so bad it felt like you was sleeping on the train track. We booked a family room for 4 and only had rood for 3. Location was very good. Wouldn't stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Very basic, but adequate.”
Reviews.Author: Robertaa93
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my family for one night, before getting an early train to Disneyland Paris the next morning. Like the title says, it was very basic, just had what you need - 2 towels, one small bar of soap, an extra pillow and sheets (for sofa bed), kettle + mugs +coffee/tea/sugar, tv with enough channels, a fan. As a family of 4, we asked for some more towels and pillows, which the staff were fine with, though they generally seemed fed up and could have been a bit friendlier. And I suppose they could have had the towels and pillows in the room already anyway, sine they knew there was 4 of us. It had a double bed and a sofa bed, which were alright, the radiator didn't seem to work (or we just didn't know how to turn it on), but it was boiling anyway so we didn't mind. Can't say there was much disturbing outside noise, but it may depend where you are in the hotel. Not a great view, but this wouldn't be your holiday, so it doesn't matter (to us anyway.) So, overall, an adequate hotel, suitable for one or two night stay.

Reviews.Title: “Don't bother!”
Reviews.Author: NoFishShropshire
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 1 night prior to catching eurostar. Big mistake. Tiny room for 4 people, had to climb over each other. Room ridiculously hot not very clean either. Would have got more sleep sat on a chair at the train station! My advise - pay a bit more and get a half decent night sleep!

Reviews.Title: “Ok”
Reviews.Author: Dannylang
Reviews.Content: Firstly, I am certain that the main picture on here is not the right hotel- it didnt look anything like that. There is a another travelodge close by called Kings Cross Royal Scot so don't get confused. We stayed here for one night before getting the Eurostar to Paris so we weren't expecting much- just somewhere to have a decent sleep before travelling. The hotel is a short walk from Euston Station and St Pancras is very close in a very busy part of London! There are plenty of bars, restaurants and take aways around the hotel. We arrived at the hotel under an hour earlier than the check in time with 2 large cases and bags but were told we could not check in until the exact time. Which is fair enough (I know most hotels will check you in earlier) but we were told we could not leave our bags and cases whilst we went to explore the area! We had to carry them around with us.Every hotel I have been to will always let you keep bags in a room if you cannot check in. So a bit of a bad start.... The room was ok- nothing special. I have stayed in a few Travelodges and they are nowhere near on a par with Premier Inn but are always cheaper. The bed wasn't very comfy and the TV was in a very awkward position to the bed! Bathroom was spotless and modern with a great shower to wake us up early in the morning so we must have had a bit of luck judging from some of the other guests photos and comments, The hotel doesn't have a restaurant or cafe but does have a small bar- I went out to a pub about a 5 minute walk away which was much better. My girlfriend didn't like the hotel at all but I thought it was ok.

Reviews.Title: “Basic, clean and convenient”
Reviews.Author: Jostie
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Kings Cross Travelodge twice in August, either side of a Eurostar trip. Excellent location, clean basic rooms but very hot. No air con or fans and as we arrived late one summer night, the room was unbearably hot, add to that 4 of us in a family room it wasn't the most comfortable nights rest. But it was reasonably priced and so close to the station, we were reasonably happy. Travelodge seem to be pretty consistent, wherever they are. Staff helpful and no problems.

Reviews.Title: “very average”
Reviews.Author: locker14
Reviews.Content: We stayed here from the 16th august for 3 nights .I was aware of the poor reviews and was expecting the worst .We were given a room on the 4th floor which overlooked the train tracks .The pull out bed did not look great and the duvet was stained so we asked to be moved .The staff cleaning the rooms had little or no English and gestured to me to see reception . I did find the reception staff helpful and we were given a quiet room straight away . Breakfast was a continental style buffet with plenty of food available .The only gripe there was the cutlery was not cleaned properly and was grubby . I found this hotel average and any problems we had were dealt with without much hassle .Its close to the tube and a good base for seeing London . Would i be back ?Yes i think i would > Its very average but is good value and in an excellent location to get into central london

Reviews.Title: “Clean and comfortable, but windows only open 1 inch”
Reviews.Author: Poussis
Reviews.Content: There seem to be 2 Travelodge hotels near Kings Cross, but Tripadvisor just has the one pic at the top. My review is for the (new?) one in Grays Inn Road, with the interesting old stone facade, not the steel and glass 70s one. Behind the old facade this is a modern functional hotel with little character. The room was very clean, the bed extremely comfortable, the shower clean and efficient. It was also very quiet, despite being a short walk from Kings Cross. Very convenient for Eurostar, and we got the room for a bargain Â£30 via advanced booking. Check in was polite if not particularly friendly. There's a cafe which breakfasts and other meals - we only tried the coffee (from a machine and very bad). There was only one serious problem, which is the same as we found in the Waterloo Travelodge so apologies for the repetition - you can't open the window more than one inch. They are locked into this position by a steel cable and there's nothing you can do. This, according to the notice stuck on the window, is 'for your safety'. Personally I would have thought it was safer, in the event of an emergency, to be able to open the window to shout for help, or to allow access for the fire brigade. If it is a question of child safety, then it should be easy to install child locks on the windows for parents' use. Instead, we are all being treated like children. If you can't open the window, you can't refresh the room, you can't do anything about the temperature (v. stuffy in summer). One inch is not good enough - basically I felt as if I was in a comfortable, clean prison. Give us back our windows!

Reviews.Title: “Great value, great location”
Reviews.Author: rexbarker
Reviews.Content: We needed a stop-over hotel near to Kings Cross. Booking well ahead we secured a room here for Â£29 (although that seemed a special rate for a Sunday night). At that price the hotel is superb value. It is 'typical' Travelodge inside - clean and functional. It does have a bar and a breakfast service. The outside is a glorious historic building. It is bout 5 minutes walk from Kings Cross / St Pancras and so superbly convenient if arriving / leaving from those stations. But do book ahead - the walk-in rates are considerably higher

Reviews.Title: “plain, can be hot & noisy, but cheap, clean, minimal”
Reviews.Author: WaziMom
Reviews.Content: Yes, despite walking 7 mins' away from King's Cross, you enter this place and if your room's around the back, you're directly over the tracks! Fortunately for me I was there during an unseasonally cold August night so I could open the window before going to bed to get some fresh air -- and the noise from passing trains drowned out the (tiny non-flat screen at these prices!;-) TV. But the reason I'm still giving it 'average' is that you would pay 50% more for *anything* clean and safe in this area. I've stayed at nearby Premier Inns, Ibis, etc, and got no real difference in accommodation -- this cost 75 pounds, they all came in at 100 or 125 or more, depending on timing. This wouldn't be my first choice, but you know what you're getting == not much, but just barely enough. You've been warned, so you decide!

Reviews.Title: “Discusting”
Reviews.Author: janet05015
Reviews.Content: Do not stay here , On arrival with my family and having booked two rooms i was appalled at the state of the place. The walls were filthy and only one coat hanger .The furniture was all cup stained and lights hanging off walls. The worst thing was the heat , there were two air con units on wall but neither worked and the window only opened three inches and it was really boiling with no air and unbearable. When we went for breakfast at nine thirty and nothing was left what a joke charging seven fifty for. when i asked for more pillows as we only had one each , i was told there were none left. Take my advice and do not stay in this run down hell hole of a place. Our holiday was ruined.

Reviews.Title: “Not somewhere I would recommend.”
Reviews.Author: Rupunzel_11
Reviews.Content: We stayed here with our two small children of 6 and 2, for two nights 1st and 5th August as a stop over either end of a holiday. We booked some time in advance and purely for the location being close to Erostar. The stay on the first night was by far the worst and had there been an alternative option for the other night we would have taken it. Because of the location the prices are high for what you get. I am used to budget hotels and I do not mind basic BUT.. When we arrived we were given our room - it looked tired, basic and rather scruffy. However, when we flushed the toilet it leaked, sending water (and other liquid!) from the toilet pipe flowing across the bathroom floor. We reported this straight away and were moved to another room. The bedside lamp was broken, the view was as described in some other reviews - simply the railway track. The noise was unbelievable -trains thundering past and the noise of people at a nearby cub was so loud. To make things worse it was unbearably hot. We managed to get a fan, but it has to be the worst night I have ever spent in a hotel. The staff were fine and willing to help, though it is of a concern that a room can have a leaking toilet - I am sure the previous occupant would have complained or at leat the cleaner would have been aware of water running across the floor and so I cannot understand why the room would have been allocated out while the problem remained. The breakfast was fine, nothing special but apart from the watered down orange juice the rest of it was pretty inoffensive. The hotel on the whole was pretty rundown and not somewhere I would use again at the price it charges. It is not some where I would recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Much better than expected!”
Reviews.Author: caroleanne25
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for four nights with no problems at all. We asked for and got a quiet room - no traffic or train noise. Yes the rooms do need decorating and are a bit scruffy but the room was clean, fresh clean towels, clean bedding, plenty of hot water and the bed was comfy. Tea and coffee facilities in the room was a bonus. The staff were very friendly and helpful. The travelodge is only a 2 minute walk from Kings Cross station and there are frequent buses to all areas. Didn't have breakfast at the travelodge but there are many eating places in the area. All in all a much better stay than we had expected after reading other reviews

Reviews.Title: “Don't be put off by some of the reviews”
Reviews.Author: spoyser72
Reviews.Content: i stayed here for 2 nights with my 2 children. We found the staff friendly and helpful and there was a wide choice of things in the all you can eat breakfast. Two children eat free with every paying adult which was great value. The bathroom was quite small but they used the space well . The room was basic but ample for a few nights. You can't expect The Ritz at this price. The location was great for links to public transport. Euston and Kings Cross are within walking distance and the Pentonville Road entrance to the tube is only minutes away. Next time we go to London we will be happy to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Ignore bad reviews this place is good bang for your buck.”
Reviews.Author: Flyin_Kiwi
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for one night, to attend a wedding reception at "06 St Chad's Place". It was perfect for what we needed. Comfortable bed, so close to train stations, friendly staff, and the breakfast buffet was perfect for that hangover. There was loads of food, and the staff were friendly. The room was clean, bathroom clean and tidy. We were in a room that looked over the underground tracks, but it still wasn't noisy. So if you're looking for an affordable basic room with bathroom to rest your head, I'd highly recommend this place. We'd definitely stay here again if we were ever back in London.

Reviews.Title: “Awful, awful, AWFUL!”
Reviews.Author: SouthernPride76
Reviews.Content: Travelodge Kings Cross is a sweat box, so close to train tracks its impossible to rest. I specifically called prior to arrival and asked not to be in a room at the back of the hotel by the train tracks, I was assured we would be in a room at the front of the hotel. However, we arrived to find that our room couldn't have been any closer to the tracks, right in the corner at the back of the hotel. The train tracks are both overground and underground, so it never stops. I wasn't expecting luxury, It's a budget hotel after all, I just wanted clean, somewhere to rest before an early train on the Eurostar the next day. In fact if the room was clean and tidy I might have been able to forgive the train tracks, but the room was dark, dingy and dirty, with an awful smell, and stains on the walls. It was also hot and horribly stuffy. DON'T STAY HERE!

Reviews.Title: “Even for a Travelodge, this was poor”
Reviews.Author: McKitties
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in my fair share of Travelodges and I think they must specialize in building near to railway lines - in this case I may as well have been sleeping on the tracks of the London Underground! The location was useful in terms of proximity to Kings Cross and it is acceptable as somewhere to put your head when over on business, but I would not stay here again. Some extra points - staff at reception not helpful at all, the same documentation I always present, including at all the other Travelodges I have stayed at was not enough and it was almost an interrogation in order to confirm my booking - not a great start. As usual there are no toiletries to be had, when you are only staying over night and have a single carry on bag how hard would it be to have at least some shower gel? The TV was old fashioned and had limited channels - and as always there was the frequent issue of the key-card not working on the door - even though it worked in the other inner doors! All in all - London was as always enjoyable - the Travelodge Kings Cross was not.

Reviews.Title: “"Worst hotel in the northen hemisphere?"”
Reviews.Author: TiMel87
Reviews.Content: Large room, but filthy. On arrival as I walked in the room, there was a strong smell of air freshener (to disguise what?). The window was smashed and had been repaired with sticky back plastic. There was pubic hair in the shower tray, and blonde hairs on the bedroom floor. The kettle handle and top were thick with grime and dirt -there were also flies in the room. Even the light switches were thick with dirt - a truly horrible room.

Reviews.Title: “Not as bad as I expected!”
Reviews.Author: Bangton
Reviews.Content: I've never stayed in a Travelodge before and based on the reviews wasn't really looking forward to it neither! It's certainly no palace but as a budget hotel goes it wasn't THAT bad. My room was at the front of the hotel and when I first arrived the windows were open so it seemed loud from the traffic below. As I closed them I realised there was an extra slide along layer of double glazing which reduced traffic noise (but not sirens). My work colleagues overlooked the train tracks and I do admit their experience sounded worse as they reported being awoken by the shuddering of trains going past. In short, your experience probably depends on where your room is located! The room was clean, including bathroom and shower and I couldn't hear any noise from the other guests. Bed relatively comfortable and plenty of space for me (as a lone traveller). There was no hairdryer in my room which meant going to reception. I also found myself locked out after returning from a night out and no one answered the intercom so I relied on another guest finally letting me in which was annoying! Overall though it wasn't a bad experience and I'll probably consider staying in the future when I go to London for a personal trip

Reviews.Title: “A good overnight stay, with helpful staff.”
Reviews.Author: familyoffiveonhols
Reviews.Content: Traveling as a family of five and picked the hotel as very close to St pancras for the early morning Eurostar to Disneyland Paris. The travelodge website warns you of the noise caused by the many trainlines so I phones and asked that we be put in any quieter rooms they had as travelling with young children. They did great room very quiet, clean and practical for a quick overnight stay. I will agree with other people and warn you that the rooms are roasting but when asked for a fan was provided. They had a lovely bar which provided resonably priced alcohol for London. A great quick check in which is needed with three tired children so a good stay overall.

Reviews.Title: “don't charge top dollar for a low quality experience”
Reviews.Author: v_booker07
Reviews.Content: Room 112 - dirty window - view onto a roof with noisy extractor fans. I slept (tried to sleep) with ear plugs in, but they didn't drown out the noise of the fan on the bathroom which stayed on all night, the doors on the corridor bang shut at regular intervals, all night long. The bed is like a jelly and very low. There are suspicious marks on the walls which could do with a revamp. 2 towels with nowhere to hang them and a ultra small bar of soap with - no other toiletries at all - is this normal? There is not much in the way of furniture so nothing to complain about in the 'cheap' hotel vain. However, it wasn't cheap! Â£188 room only. I think we as a nation put up with things that we shouldn't. I have worked in the hotel industry for the past 32 years and if a guest of mine complained that they didn't sleep well I would have been mortified and made sure that they were compensated in some way. I was down for a work trip - 2 very long days of work. We arrived from a long train journey to be told that if we wanted to check in before 3pm we had to pay a surcharge of Â£10 - FOR WHAT???? To sit in a small room with a dirty window?????? No, we had work to do and needed to leave our belongings. If the room is ready what is the problem?? We weren't renting by the hour! Although some of the activity to the rear of the hotel suggested that there could be a trade for it! Goodness me - its like booking a cheap flight and getting bolt on's for every thing else, making it a not very cheap flight. Why do companies feel the need to rip travellers off? Our colleagues were staying at the Premier Inn- read their review and I know where I would rather stay!

Reviews.Title: “Not great”
Reviews.Author: ash393939
Reviews.Content: We've stayed in travelodges a few times, including this one before, but this was probably our least enjoyable stay. The best things about this hotel are it's in an ideal location for being close to Kings Cross/St Pancras station, and is good value for money. The rooms are clean but basic. I agree with other reviews that it's particularly hot in the hotel. We had no choice but to open our window, but as we had a room at the back of the hotel (and was only on the 1st floor) it overlooked a noisy club and train track. Last time we stayed here, we had a different room and weren't really bothered by a bit of noise, but this time it was very noisy. We were woken up repeatedly, particularly from people shouting and screaming at each other outside the neighbouring club (and at 7am some were still loudly arguing.) On a positive note, we tried the breakfast for the first time and actually quite enjoyed it, it was fairly cheap and there was a reasonable selection. The next time we're in London, we probably won't be staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “trainline sweat box with seedy night life out side the window”
Reviews.Author: jools0001
Reviews.Content: what can you say about this hotel, no AC, no fan's, no air movement, hotter in the hotel then out side, windows only open about an inch, train line runs at the back of the hotel with no sound deadening even with window and vents closed still frees like your standing on a station platform. prostitutes working at the back of the hotel in the back road. very little sleep if any

Reviews.Title: “Not as bad as we were fearing”
Reviews.Author: Rachael H
Reviews.Content: We were dreading staying after reading the other reviews but it wasn't as bad as we had feared. Basic but ok. Our room was at the front facing the road and the noise wasn't too bad but we met a woman in the lift who had asked to be moved due to train noise at the back of the hotel. Only one towel despite two people staying. Bar was closed till 5pm so nowhere to sit and have a drink. Overall, a satisfactory base for exploring London.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible...”
Reviews.Author: TamLeamingtonSpa
Reviews.Content: I've stayed in Travelodges before and I know what to expect, all I really want is a clean comfortable room to go to sleep in. It's a fairly basic requirement of a hotel. I've stayed in this travelodge before and it was okay but the room we had was at the front of the hotel in the basement so was fairly quiet. This time around we had a room at the back of the hotel overlooking a train line and the club next door. I am under no illusions that Kings Cross is a busy area but if you are going to run a hotel that overlooks noisy things then I thinking investing in some heavy duty double glazing is a must. The noise was so bad there was absolutely no way we were ever going to get any sleep so my friend went to complain. The chap manning the desk at 2am was helpful but didn't really have any authority to do anything and no duty manager seemed to be available. The hotel was fully booked so we could not be moved so we had no option but to abandon the our room and find somewhere else to stay. We were given a refund but that wasn't the point, I can't imagine we are the first people to have had this problem, all we wanted was to go to sleep! If you're going to run a hotel, all be it a fairly budget one, then just covering the basics would be a good place to start. If you haven't been able to get some serious glazing then I think a warning to your clients that some rooms at the rear of the hotel might be noisy would have been fair allowing us to make a choice before we booked the room. I will never stay at a Travelodge again if I have any other choice.

Reviews.Title: “Experience depends on which room you get”
Reviews.Author: 2undutch
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel on a recent Sunday night. As a regular Travelodge customer I know what to expect. My sister and I both had a double room on the first and second floor respectively at the back of the building, overlooking a trainline and a tubeline. My room was the standard Travelodge quality: basic but clean and fairly comfortable. My sister's room (one floor down) was another story unfortunately. The side of the bed had very 'questionable' stains on it and the sheets didn't cover this. The tap in the bathroom was rusty! My sister only had a few hours sleep because the trains ran until 1am and then began again at 5am. Your experience at this hotel will depend very much on where your room is located. I had friends staying in another part of the hotel during a previous stay and their room was perfectly quiet. And yet another friend had a room at the front of the hotel - on Grays Inn Road - and he couldn't sleep all night because of the noise. One thing about the main photo of the hotel on this TripAdvisor page: it is a picture of Travelodge Kings Cross Royal Scott - about 5 minutes down the road - not the actual Travelodge Kings Cross that this review page is about.

Reviews.Title: “NOT AS BAD AS REVIEWED”
Reviews.Author: stevewood1966
Reviews.Content: .the bar area was open late for pizzas and drinks, slight noise from trains to be expected near the station nice clean but basic rooms which was okay would stay there again

Reviews.Title: “Clean and Comfortable”
Reviews.Author: Nb76
Reviews.Content: Clean room, great staff and great location...what else do you need? Breakfast was good but they don't offer a hot breakfast and I do like my bacon but apart from that an alround enjoyable stay.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location - no problems”
Reviews.Author: JhdAndCo
Reviews.Content: Ideal location just around the corner from Kings Cross. We heard absolutely no noise, which surprised us. A typical Travelodge rooms - no complaints at all. Lots of cafes, bars and some restaurants round and about. We have recommended this hotel to friends!

Reviews.Title: “great location but be prepared for the train noise”
Reviews.Author: ladyb30
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for one night after a 2 week holiday. Great location for taking a train from Kings Cross Rail station and many places to eat around central London. My only complaints would be the state of the rooms and the noise from the trains (but I was expecting some of the noise). The rooms were very basic and in need of a good clean and a touch up of paint. The staff however were friendly and welcoming.

Reviews.Title: “Not great, but not as bad as some reviews would have you believe.”
Reviews.Author: paulmcleod10
Reviews.Content: We had some reservations about going to this hotel, having read reviews from other travellers on this site. However, it's not at all as bad as I had feared. Keeping in mind that it is a basic, busy, and inexpensive city centre Travelodge, it appeared clean and well maintained. They were painting corridors on the day we arrived. The room was pretty small but adequate for our needs. The view from the window was a bit bleak, but you really only need somewhere to sleep and shower when in London. The bed was very comfortable. We opted for the continental breakfast. It was basic and probably a bit overpriced, but adequate. The location is excellent, as we were travelling to and from Kings Cross Station. The underground being so close was great and you can walk into the West End in about 30 mins, which we did a couple of times. The only real negatives we had were there were 2 of us, however, they only provided one bath towel, which meant someone would have to get dried with a wet one. We got an extra towel from reception, but unfortunately, the maid took it away again and didn't replace it!! The other was that they could do with putting something on the corridor fire doors to stop them banging shut. You expect to have to hear some noise from the corridors etc but the banging of the 2 doors near our room was a bit irritating, especially at 5.30am!!! On the whole, I'd stay there again, as it wasn't expensive and is in a very handy location for getting to all the major sites in London.

Reviews.Title: “Better than expected”
Reviews.Author: Amy_Smith84
Reviews.Content: A colleague booked me this hotel and after reading the reviews online I was dreading visiting it. On arrival I was pleasently surprised. Located right next to the station it's so easy to get to and since we were getting a really early train in the morning it meant a case of rollign out of bed and onto the train which was great. Check in was simple and automated making things nice and quick. The rooms were clean but very basic and having to request a hairdryer wasn't ideal but they do have them (even if you have to return it the same day). I was also located in the basement meaning a streetview window which didnt leave you with much privacy. Pillows were also quite hard. Overall it did the job for a business trip but I definitly wouldnt go on a leisure trip. Don't beleive all the bad reviews.

Reviews.Title: “Awful - worst place I have ever stayed”
Reviews.Author: Biddlesden
Reviews.Content: OMG this place is awful. Our room was small and smelt and the bed was pushed up against the wall. It was supposed to be a nice break away with my partner. Awful awful place

Reviews.Title: “Awful Hotel with Awful customer Service”
Reviews.Author: Sir-Travelalott
Reviews.Content: I stayed one night in this hotel with two work colleagues and it was a very unpleasant experience. Firstly, my company accidentally booked and paid for the rooms twice. We talked to the receptionist on arrival about this who informed us even though they were oversubscribed that night she would not refund any of the money we had accidentally paid to them. My company probably books 100- 150 rooms per year with Travelodge and we all felt that this was a very poor level of service given the amount of business we give Travelodge and has made us as a company try to avoid the whole of the Travelodge chain since this experience. When I eventually got to one of my rooms I was greeted with one of the worst rooms I have ever seen in any branded hotel chain. I counted 14 pubic hairs in my bath. The wall paper was either missing of hanging off in large areas of the hotel. There was mould in the corners of the room, the furniture was very tatty and the whole room had a bad musty smell. When I complained about my room to the receptionist she took a very long time to sort it out and in the mean time was laughing and joking with her colleague while I stood there waiting! Very poor service. The room I was given after I complained was better in the respect that it had no pubic hair in the bath. My colleague actually took the time to write to Travelodge to highlight the disappointing service we received but one month later we have still not received a reply. I am not surprised as it appears that Travelodge has absolutely no interest in retaining it's loyal customers over many years. I have noticed that the quality of Travelodge in general has fallen in recent years and in my opinion has now fallen below that which is acceptable. Premier Inn are a much better chain and will be getting my business wherever possible from now on.

Reviews.Title: “DONT BELEIVE ALL THE BAD REVIEWS”
Reviews.Author: Fiona064
Reviews.Content: I was dreading going to this hotel after reading recent reviews, however I have to tell everyone who is considering going here, i was pleasantly surprised (and I am very fussy about hotels etc!) The hotel is in a great location, lovely old building, reception staff friendly, reception area and corridors to rooms very clean. Room was clean, plently room and quiet. We were on the 3rd floor in a double room which faced the back of the hotel so there was no noise at all. The bathroom was spotless as well. Breakfast was impressive, was continental but plenty choice and the bar area was clean. I would tell anyone thinking of going here but put off by reading the reviews, not to believe what everyone has written. If you know what to expect from a travelodge then you will not be disappointed. Kings cross iteslf is not the best location to stay and have a meal and drinks, but it is so close to the train station which was good. It does not cost a lot to travel to other areas to eat, drink etc.

Reviews.Title: “Named brand with a let down”
Reviews.Author: Hal71
Reviews.Content: First time used Travel Lodge usually stay at Premier Inn 2-3 times a year. First time payed so much for a buget hotel. First time I've had to make the beds up myself when staying in a family room. First time only had one thin pillow each and when requested more as I have a bad back being limited to one more each. First time my husband, myself and our two children had to share 2 towels and as it was hot and sticky they were used, alot. First time stayed at Kings Cross. Our room was directly over a trainline and on the opposite side a pub with beer garden. The Walls were dirty, The beds uncomfortable, the settee/ two single beds for children left no space on the floor. We visited for the Royal Wedding and although most people seemed to be in coats or jumpers we were in t-shirts and still warm. Needless to say we had the window open during the night, had to as room very small and 4 of us in it , it got very hot. None of us slept despite not going to bed till late and being exhausted from being up before 5 that morning and spending all day walking round London. The train pulled into station like clockwork I loss track how many times, certainly didn't stop during night and with celebrations going on pub only started to have people leaving at 2.30am. Ive NEVER stayed anywhere so noisy in my life. Wrong hotel chain and wrong hotel for us, back to Premier Inn next time.

Reviews.Title: “Late 70s Soviet union style hotel - Give it a miss!”
Reviews.Author: aeloygut
Reviews.Content: This is by far the worst hotel I have ever stayed at. Even though the Travelodge policy is that you know what you are getting as all their hotels are of the same standard, this one obviously fail to follow such policy. This was such a letdown as I normally would not book a hotel until I have tripadvisored it. It is my own fault for believing that all Travelodges were of the same quality. I have stayed in the one in Cardiff and could not fault it... However, this one must be given a miss. The room was horrible, the water taps did not work, there were pubic hairs in the bath, the beds were tatty and uncomfortable, the window was broken and wonky, the carpet was dirty and was not properly fitted around the skirting board. The lighting was dark and gloomy. Even the door was cheap MDF and really flimsy. The furniture was dated and looked like it came out of a charity shop. The mattress sacked in the middle and it felt like we were about to touch the floor. The hotel is loud and very dirty. I cannot stress it enough how annoyed we were when we got there. I believe the Travelodge advertising is misleading. Awful place... I would rather have paid more and stayed in a better place or paid the same and stay on the outskirts of London.

Reviews.Title: “great location and served its purpose”
Reviews.Author: iluvmababyz
