Reviews.Content: we decided to book this room as our train was due into st pancras after 9pm at night so thought it best to stay in london overnight with our 2 very tired small children (4 & 1) instead of going straight home. unfortunatly the taxi driver took us to the wrong hotel (there are 3 in the area) so instead of geting another we decided to walk, all 3 of the travelodges in the area are within walking distance from each other. once we arrived we were greeted by a very friendly reception and checked in rather quickly our room was fine we basically wet straight to bed as really tired from the train ride (and 6 days of walking around disneyland paris) there was noise from the trains as it is right next to the train station but this didnt bother us as both children went to sleep straight away. the let down for me was the matress, it was not the best matress ive slept on, it sunk in the middle other than this everything was fine. continental breakfast was great would reccommend for a hotel near to the train station for an overnight stay, but wouldnt reccommend a longer stay

Reviews.Title: “Good Location for Travel”
Reviews.Author: lincolnshireposy
Reviews.Content: The location couldn't be better for an early train - a few minutes walk from the front door and you are on the platform, no need for tubes or taxis. It is bang on the main road and easy to find. If you don't want to be near to trains and a busy road, then don't choose this one, the clue is in the Lodge's name. If I ever stay here again it will be for that perk only, as there are no other good points. The Lodge is old and desperately needs serious renovation. My room was in the basement, and one sniff of the dank, chilly atmosphere (plus the mould in the bathroom) sent me back upstairs for a room change. Next room was located on the top floor and I assume was part of a new conversion at some point as it seemed newer with the 'blue' theme running through. Clearly, as many rooms as possible had been squeezed in as this was a strange shape with a cupboard sized shower room, ridiculously sold as a family room. Again it was freezing and the heater struggled to even remove the chill on full power. As I was paying the flexible rate I don't think it was good value. I've stayed in some very smart and comfortable TL rooms for less than Â£20, so to pay just shy of Â£100 for a cold, tiny, shabby room doesn't make sense and TL needs to close that gap - or else operate on a Â£20 basis only.

Reviews.Title: “Horrendous”
Reviews.Author: Rugby69
Reviews.Content: Worst hotel I have ever stayed in. Extremely expensive, dirty, terrible food, Â£15 to park for the evening I could go on and list everything but I think you get the picture. Stay here at your peril. Actually just don't stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Extremely Bad Nights Sleep!”
Reviews.Author: Bestopher88
Reviews.Content: We booked in to stay here on our outward and return journey on the Euro star. We arrived on the Sunday and checked in no problems, However the moment I got in to my room I was shocked at how close the room was to the train tracks. This became more of an issue as the night went on with approximately at least one train every 2 mins, until at least midnight when they became less frequent, They started getting more frequent again about 5am. After this experience I was dreading the return stay on the Saturday night, Again the trains were extremely noisy! but also there is a bar/club in close proximity that had loud music until the small hours. None of this is mentioned on the Travelodge website. I definitely will NOT be staying here again! and advise fellow travellers not to if they actually want to sleep!!

Reviews.Title: “Just The Wrong Side Of The Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: mattvark
Reviews.Content: We booked this travelodge as travelling on Eurostar to Disney early in the morning and needed to be near St Pancreas Station - at the time of booking we just did not realise how close we were going to be! I had read all the comments on here and was really nervous about booking, however as we have stayed in lots of travelodges and there were also a lot of positive comments on here also I thought it would be fine. The hotel itself is nice & clean, the staff were friendly, the room was what we expected and we had no complaints. The facilities around the hotel are great, pleanty of bars and places to eat and great location. We were two couples travelling with 2 small children, upon our arrival we asked for quiet rooms due to the comments made about the noise from the railway but were told that all the quiet rooms were gone. Both our rooms were at the back of the building and when we looked out of the window we saw that the tracks on the railway ran directly behind us. We thought that this would be ok, however from the moment the first train went by, we knew we would be in for a long night. The noise is hideous! I can usually sleep through a hurricane however as the trains run every 3-4 minutes and the only time they stop is between 2am and 5am - we only got 3 hours sleep! Not a great start to a holiday. I am sure that had we been at the front of the building it would not have been a problem at all (we did not hear the trains when we were in the resturant at the front of the building) and we would have had a great nights sleep. I guess the upshot is if you are put at the front of the building, you will be fine and will have a great experience, however if you are unfortunate enough to be put at the back of the building, expect a sleepless night.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location, great price for a london hotel and basic but good”
Reviews.Author: onemanmade
Reviews.Content: First off, contrary to most of the reviews here on this hotel, I didnt find it bad at all to stay in, the price was extremely reasonable for a central London hotel, and is a great base from which to travel in London! A minutes walk from Kings cross station. We were self catering and did not partake in the hotel's breakfast so I cant comment on that, although the option of a cooked breakfast was not there, which was why we didnt opt for the breakfast. Staff were friendly and the rooms were clean, an en suite bathroom with a shower was included, which was basic but good. There were tea and coffee making facilities and a tv in the room, as for the noise I didnt really notice any, got great nights sleep, and we stayed for 3 nights. We could hear other people if they walked past our room, but not noisy like some of the other reviews say. Ok, its not a fancy hotel, but at the price is very good, especially for central London!! I would stay again if the opportunity arose.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: kirstylou142
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel before reading the reviews on this site, so to say I was worried about it is an understatement. This was the first time I'd ever booked into a hotel by myself so I was understandably nervous, which was not helped when I tried to check my booking on the Travelodge website only to discover that there was appatently no trace of the booking or my account. I went to the hotel directly from King's Cross and sorted it there and then. I had tweeted travelodge after my failed attempt to log on and, as luck would have it, the duty manager that day had seen my tweet and sorted my booking before I arrived. I duly paid Â£10 to check in early and was allocated room 128. This was perfect for what I needed and pretty good value for Â£69.50. The room and shower were exceptionally clean (I know, I checked after reports on here!) and the bed was very comfortable. I also liked the fact that no-one could get onto the corridor without the keycards, it made me feel a lot more secure, particularly as a lone female traveller. I would quite happily recommend this hotel to friends and family, the security, staff and location make it worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Never ever again!!!!”
Reviews.Author: nooshin123
Reviews.Content: Apart from friendly reception,there is nothing else to say about this hotel.no.house keeping.no room service.uncomfortable bed. and no view.l will never book this hotel again.don't be fooled by its name!!

Reviews.Title: “ideally situated hotel”
Reviews.Author: flowergirl45
Reviews.Content: This hotel is only 5mins away from Kings Cross and all the buses so made a great base for our days sightseeing. Family room a bit cramped. The window had a draught from it which you felt on you kneck when you sat watching the tv on the sofa bed. The room was really cold and we had to keep putting the heater on full esp when you got in after 8pm. The sofa bed was also all faded on the part in front of the window and delved down in the middle. The mattress had a stain on it but all the sheets were clean. The duvet cover for this bed was crazy as it opened at either end and the quilt got all taffled up inside it.T The door in the bathroom only just scraped by the toilet and the shower was set in the wall high up so to shower young children would be impossible. The cleaning staff were really nice and we had fresh towels and refreshments every day. The breakfasts were really nice and we had plenty to choose from and as much as you liked and the young girl was really friendly and helpful. The only staff who were offhand were the young men on the reception on the day we came and the day we left. We would stay again as we had a good location and as someone else said you get what you pay for and we had paid the same amount for a tiny room and an awful breakfast in one of the little streets opposite Kings Cross and that was the pits. It just need redecorating to keep it up todate and then the visitors will keep going to it.

Reviews.Title: “just read this review for honesty”
Reviews.Author: bodgerboro
Reviews.Content: rite ok this isnt the hilton. me and my partner paid Â£72 for 2 nights and got cheap rail having stayed at the royal national ( awful ) imperial and president hotel ( good ) we changed to the travelodge kings cross for this trip literally a minutes walks from kings cross, rooms just normal nothing else. if you want a jacuzzi in your room pay jacuzzi prices. ask for a quiet room and you will get a quiet room simple as that. people who say it is noisy are talking rubbish. what do you really expect in central london? theres going to be noise from outside but only heard normal traffic that was it. you are in the congestion zone after all. there are no bed bugs in your room as stated by someone else it is totally fine. staff really helpful and smiling. asked for an extra pillow got extra pillow. [people need to stop moaning or pay more. just to warn people though you can hear people in and out of their rooms but this will happen in every hotel. seriously if you want a normal quiet stay then go here. plenty of restaraunts and takeaways near by. please feel free to ask me any questions. oh two more things. the bar on a friday and saturday is open till 5 in the morning which i imagine could cause noise . also i noticed the bar was doing 5 bottles of peroni for Â£10 BARGAIN I AM SPEAKING THE TRUTH ON THIS HOTEL. i have often wrote poor reviews on hotels ( kiroseiz three corners egypt ) and the royal national london ( russell square ) and this one is fine

Reviews.Title: “Forget the bar.................”
Reviews.Author: DavoCheshire
Reviews.Content: You get what you pay for. Â£59 a night for a small but tidy room. Unfortunately very noisy due to tube line being right outside, although it quitened down after about 1am. Be aware that the cafe-bar closes at 11pm during the week. We turned up at 11pm and the door was locked! Only very expensive bottled lager. Great breakfasts at the cafe opposite. Very convenient location

Reviews.Title: “Noisy and badly organised, but handy for station!!”
Reviews.Author: weekenderinthesun
Reviews.Content: I stayed here recently with my family- Â£65 per night for 4 in central London is a good deal. However, I wish I'd read these reviews and taken ear plugs!! The hotel is close to the main KX terminal but locacted directly above a train line for Thamesink- so there were trains outside our window until about midnight, starting again at 5 in the morning. The noise was awful, too loud to be able to hear the TV in the room. The double glazing was inefectual, and very draughty. could easily be fixed I'm sure by investing in new windows We stayed in the school holidays, so expected the place to be busy, But breakfast was laughable, They ran out of Glasses, coffee cups, spoons, knives and plates during the half hour or so we were there, with only 2 staff in the place sorting out the washing up. No excuse for that really! The room itself was fine, although I had to ask repeadedly for replacement toilet rolls- they would only give us one at a time!! Also there are 2 lifts at the hotel, one was out of order all the time during our stay. we were told by residents of the flats which share this building that it had been out of service for 6 months or more. But it was clean and convenient, and cheap, so not all bad!

Reviews.Title: “Shocking hotel lets down the Travelodge chain”
Reviews.Author: skbarron
Reviews.Content: A friend and I were heading to Paris on the Eurostar and decided to stay here for one night before travelling. Having stayed in various Travelodges across the country we decided that we 'could'nt go wrong' with this hotel. At Â£59 for one night it was affordable. Upon arrival there was a queue at reception and no staff present. We decided to use the self service check in machines (a handy tool) and were given our key and breakfast vouchers automatically. One of the lifts was out of service and the one that was working was not clean. We located our room and the sleeping area was ok. As there were two of us, we planned to use the sofa bed. Pulling it out, then sheet barely covered the bed and a cold breeze came from under the sofa. Our room had a great view of the train line and the subsequent noise would have kept me awake had I not packed ear plugs. The night was also full of various sirens - it seems to not be the safest area. The bathroom was cramped - the door almost scraped the toilet bowl when closed and the shower although hot and powerful was not the cleanest and had black grouting. Sleep was hard to get as there were screaming and shouting teenagers running up and down the corridors and slamming doors. At breakfast the next morning we saw our first member of staff who looked like he'd rather be anywhere than there. The breakfast room is the bar and definitely not worth the price asked - however, no-one checked our vouchers so we could easily have eaten for free! Check out was done with a grumpy member of staff just pointing and grunting at a key drop box! Not a pleasant stay! Thankfully I have stayed in better Travelodges and will not be put off the chain however, I would not stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Dreary”
Reviews.Author: FordPrefect421
Reviews.Content: Arrived at 9pm and stayed 1 night as getting an early eurostar. The most depressing and dreary hole I have ever stayed in. Automatic check in and rude bar staff. The bar was characterless and soleless, we had one drink and disappeared to our room. The bathroom was filthy and the rooms and corridors in dire need of decorating. The bed was comfy however the noise from the nearby pub was not good. The website reported the train noise, however it was not too bad. Find another hotel

Reviews.Title: “Good, value for money hotel - do NOT confuse with Royal Scot!!!”
Reviews.Author: Meggymog
Reviews.Content: This is hotel is in alovely old building in a great location with buses to all the major parts of London on your doorstep. Lots of nice restaurants nearby and handy for Eurostar and Kings Cross stations. We had rooms on 2nd floor (stayed their twice now). and although basic the rooms were very clean had tv, tea/coffee stuff etc etc. Only downsie was they were a bit stingy with the towels - especialloy in the family room. One of the rooms backed onto the railway line so until about midnight there was the sound of trains, but we slept well. We did not have the breakfast as there are places close by and, to be honest, I never think the Travelodge breakfasts are that great anyway! On the first part of our stay we for the rooms for Â£29 each which was brilliant value for money. One thing definitely to note is that in no way should this hotel be compared to the Kings Cross Royal Scot Travelodge which is half a mile away - that is a stinking, hole and...trust me.....you would not put a rat to stay there!!!!! (although I suspect that there may already be a few) - we had a room booked there for the retrun part of our stay and had to move it was just horrific!!!

Reviews.Title: “Going off the rails”
Reviews.Author: glasgowman01
Reviews.Content: Stayed here many times but it is going down hill fast. Great location near the station , friendly continental staff ... The big downside is the place is getting very shabby, dirty sticky flooring in rooms and lifts, sense of uncleanliness and decay. Travelodge needs to get better or competitors will overtake them very soon .

Reviews.Title: “absolutely fine!”
Reviews.Author: michelleac
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for one night as travelling on Eurostar and found it to be absolutely fine! Staff were helpful and as I had called earlier in the day to ask for a high floor they acknowledged I had called and gave us a room on the 5th floor (as had read on here its noisy) and slept fine with no noise to be heard! The room was basic but clean and they had put the heating on for us so it was nice and toasty. Tea and coffee facilities and nice clean bathroom. I have paid more and stayed in much worse places than this! Dont listen to all reviews..!

Reviews.Title: “I got a good deal for what I payed, if you want more pay more.”
Reviews.Author: FairHonestGuy
Reviews.Content: I am a working man with a modest wage two young kids and a wife. Not a millionaire expecting people kissing my butt. So I am realistic for what I get for my money. I expect a hotel room to be a base to get my head down and recharge in the evening. The Hotel is not my holiday or short break. I stopped at Kingscross Travellodge which is a short walk from the Railway Station (5mins). The receptionist could not have been nicer. I asked for a quite family room. That is exactly what I got (Room Three Basement). But I always take ear plugs with being a light sleeper. The room was â€œHotel Cleanâ€� not to my home standard but what hotel is. Clean bed linen and clean shower and toilet. The extractor fan did not seem to be working so after morning ablutions from four people it was smelly. The TV worked fine. The pull out bed seemed to have a stain on it from spilled tea. But again clean linen. The bar was ok nothing to write home about but nothing to complain about. Be real guys Â£75.00 for four people for two nights In London on the 21st of December, I got a bargain. I have payed more and got less in other countries. We payed Â£60.00 on the London eye for 20 mins If you want a holiday that is your hotel room go pay Â£200.00 a night each. Great deal Travellodge I would stop again 10 out of 10 for what I payed.

Reviews.Title: “Not great. Like most travelodges but noisy”
Reviews.Author: carl-11111__
Reviews.Content: I thought all travelodges were exactly the sameâ€¦and this one is almost. The hotel and room just looked a bit worn. There was a rip in the bed sheet and no shower gel but apart from that not too bad. The main problem was the noise â€“ although I expected it, it did keep me awake and I didnâ€™t get much sleep. If I needed to stay in the area again I wouldnâ€™t choose here even though it is cheap.

Reviews.Title: “Worst hotel ever”
Reviews.Author: flipperke78
Reviews.Content: Dust nets in the room, shower was not cleaned properly when we arrived, humidity spots on the walls, 2p room with 1 closet, 1 chair, 1 set of towels. Outside temp: 0Â°C, inside temp with heater on full power for more than 24h: 15Â° 3 elevators, working elevators: none (we were on the 6th (= top) floor). No personel willing to help carry our suitcases up and down the stairs. Bad breakfast buffet: orange juice tasted watery, no hot drinks because of electricity fail. Second day: no breakfast at all while paid for it.

Reviews.Title: “A very disappointing travelodge”
Reviews.Author: NorthumberlandTigger
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my mother and two children in my opinion this was a bad travelodge and in need of some repair and a bit of customer service training for staff. we paid Â£105 for one room which is a lot of money for what you got grumpy receptionists which ignore you when your booking in, bedsheets with holes in them, a kettle that only worked if you held it in place, a toilet door handle that kept falling off and windows that didn't shut. other than that the room was ok. The cafe bar advertised selling pizza's so i went to go and get one for my daughter i ordered that then went accross the road to buy some milk only to see the bar man coming out of the pizza shop next to the travelodge with my daughters pizza which incidentley cold and not cooked properly. It really was unbelieveable.

Reviews.Title: “Good Travelodge”
Reviews.Author: Icky_10
Reviews.Content: Travelodge Kings Cross is quite a decent one compaired to Travelodge Royal Scot which is 500 yards around the corner from this one, avoid Royal Scot at all costs its a dump. This travelodge is in an excellent position for Kings Cross/ St Pancras stations and good to get to all parts of London too. Plesant staff and easy book in and good size clean family rooms. Only one drawback was that our room was close to the underground with noise from the trains but eased of later in the evening, but still not a bad Travelodge. Would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Very noisy - trains and a night club until 2am”
Reviews.Author: Sybil_Ramkin
Reviews.Content: Stayed one night prior to a meeting. The check in was fine and security is tight as I had to use my room key to access the front door, inner door, lift and then the bedrooms floor, and then my bedroom! The room was very basic but generally clean. Bathroom was OK with good water pressure in shower but do take your own toiletries as all that is provided is a very small piece of soap. The main problem was the noise. I could have coped with the trains which stopped at about 1am and started again about 6am but the night club was awful! It is directly behind the hotel and the noise was overwhelming. My colleagues also complained as we did not have any sleep until about 2.30. There was also a problem with hair dryers - you need to request one from reception but they are limited. We had the last one which left a very irrate woman arguing at reception and she then turned on us - odd! Would probaly not stay here again

Reviews.Title: “Noisy, dirty, crappy service where I had the misfortune to stay”
Reviews.Author: Tomcattim
Reviews.Content: Due to the Xmas rush. I couldnt get anywhere else near kings cross and had to stay here. The hotel rooms are dirty, staff are rude, the place is so noisy. This hotel is a disgrace! The staff I am sure have a competition to see who can be the most arrogant to visitors to our country. I stood at the desk and witnessed them one by one sneer at guests. I would sack the lot. Do not go here unless you are a hotel owner and want to see what crap really is in the hotel trade

Reviews.Title: “Marked down only because of cost of stay”
Reviews.Author: travelodgie
Reviews.Content: The receptionist was very nice and offered to book me onto the 5th floor as it was quieter. He did warn that there was no lift from 4th to 5th floor, so it may not suit some travellers. The double room was bigger than some Travelodges I've stayed at previously. Paid Â£75 and bitter about it because I know and earlier booking would have been much cheaper. I think I would be happy to pay Â£50/night for my stay (considering it IS in central London after all!) Location wise, very close to Kings Cross so would suit even those with heavy luggage. Loads of eateries around (cheap cafes, McDs, Starbucks, Pret) so don't feel like you have to purchase in house breakfast. Ironing board and iron available from reception and they were not too fussy about when I had to return it.

Reviews.Title: “good dependant on which bit of the hotel you stay in!”
Reviews.Author: mamaberry
Reviews.Content: stayed two nights either side of a trip to Disneyland Paris. The first night was on the second floor and overlooked the train lines, my 2 yr old was constantly at the window watching the trains (the window was wired to stop it opening, reassuring), unfortunately the train noise was very sleep disturbing, sounded like the window was open even though it wasn't. The room was clean and warm, the bathroom was small but the shower was hot and powerful. The second night we were in the basement on the opposite side of the hotel which was much quieter and peaceful. Staff were friendly and provided extra pillows when requested. There is no luggage storage facility. Breakfast was continental and fairly basic, the 'restaurant' is small and although quiet when we stayed mid week is probably crammed a busy times. It has a lift. It is 3-4 minutes walk from Kings Cross underground and St Pancreas International - Eruostar terminal.

Reviews.Title: “i am a travelodgaholic”
Reviews.Author: kernow666
Reviews.Content: i love stayingh at travelodges , always have great deals , most i have spent has been Â£49 most times its Â£19 or Â£29 and cannot complain about them , stayed at the majority in london and all perfect yes some are a bit rough round edges but the turnover is high and the poor eastern europeans who work there are paid a pittance but staff are always friendly and bed are always comfy

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value for Â£29 per night!!!”
Reviews.Author: lbeevs
Reviews.Content: Perfect location, very clean, VERY quiet (we had a good & uninterupted nights sleep), friendly staff. I'm not sure why there are so many negatives about this place but for the price we paid it was great value. We did ask for a quiet room and maybe thats why it was quiet! But no grumbles at all & I would definately stay again.

Reviews.Title: “you take your chances here, could be a good stay but then again.”
Reviews.Author: Mike711
Reviews.Content: Was no toilet paper in the room, but otherwise the room was clean and warm. Got some rolls from reception together with apology only to find the toilet didn't flush properly looked like poor water pressure which made me think the absence of toilet rolls was meant to discourage using the toilet. The queue (sorry line of anticipation) for breakfast on sunday morning was over 10 minutes but it was a good breakfast. There were spaces for only a few cars at the hotel, costing Â£15 per day but this could be paid using a card on the telephone. Staff were first rate.

Reviews.Title: “Clean room, excellent central London location, but a bit noisy”
Reviews.Author: ScotsMel
Reviews.Content: If you're looking for a cheap room for one or two nights in Central London then you can't go wrong with this Travelodge. It's nothing fancy - but the rooms are clean, towels are fresh and the water is hot. Located opposite Kings Cross station and St Pancras it's ideal for onwards travel to Paris, Brussels etc and has easy Underground access. On the downside... avoid the breakfast - it's terrible and a rip off. There are no cooked items and you even have to make the toast yourself! Also, if you're a light sleeper you may be put off by the noise. The Travelodge entrance is on a busy road and the back looks on to the busy Kings Cross railway line. Apart from that, I thought it was fine!

Reviews.Title: “Can't beat the price. My room was great.”
Reviews.Author: cl1811
Reviews.Content: I paid 19 for the night plus 10 for early check-in. No facilities for luggage storage if you arrive before check-in time, so keep this in mind when deciding on early check-in.What a great value for any city, much less London. Easy walk from Euston or Kings Cross/St. Pancras stations. Efficient checkin. I liked the added security of the lifts and corridor entrances requiring use of the cardkey for entry. Corridors on 3rd floor did have some strange smells, but my room was very clean, modern, comfortable, and good-sized. No problem with any noise. Rooms don't have telephones or alarm clocks, so be prepared with a travel alarm clock or use the alarm function on your mobile if you need a wake-up call. I had no problems during my stay and would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Falco9
Reviews.Content: If you enjoy being kept up all night by teenage drunks outside the hotel followed by drunken guests coming in at all hours laughing & shouting en-route to their rooms then this could be the hotel for you. If you're not certain though, how about having to step over someones vomit on the way into breakfast? (it was stil being cleaned up on the way back) Yes its a cheap hotel but there must be better than this available for the money, avoid at all costs

Reviews.Title: “Can manage for 1 night only, if you are travelling on train or Eurostar”
Reviews.Author: Markaz
Reviews.Content: This hotel is about the location. It's very close to the station for trains and Eurostar travel. Very convenient indeed. The checking in was OK, but the room we were given on the ground floor had a used bed and wet dirty towel thrown on the bed. This was along a corridor that smelled of cat wee. Back to reception but they found us another room quickly enough. No problem with the staff at all. 2nd room on 3rd floor. Small but clean. Shower OK. Bed FAR too soft but some people like soft beds. Our room was quiet so no complaints there. Left early next morning for Eurostar. For middle London the price is manageable for what you get. Basic and convenient. Don't book in for a week!

Reviews.Title: “Take ear plugs or go someone else”
Reviews.Author: srnetworks
Reviews.Content: Arrived in the hotel to find it well located, generally clean and the staff pleasent. However on looking our of the window of my room on the rear of the hotel i found that we where about 4 floors above a tube line. We immediately went out for dinner, so didn't really think more of it. Until 0530. The tube trains where so loud that the first one woke me and then every train following kept me awake. The pass every 2-3 mins at least. In the end i got up at 0630 and conceeded defeat. Dont go here want to sleep after 0530! As others have mentioned, the breakfast is appaling considering what you pay. i managed one ropey looking croissant and some cereals out of a box. We ended up buying something else in London.

Reviews.Title: “excellent”
Reviews.Author: nigelhYork
Reviews.Content: My wife and I were a bit sceptical and first. But that soon changed when we checked in. Very quick and easy. The hotel is about 2 mins walk from Kings Cross station. We had no trouble with train noise at all. When coming back from a night out about 12.30 we felt very safe around the hotel area. We decided to stay at King Cross as it was easy for the tube and also our train home. Altogether a very pleasurable stay and stress free.

Reviews.Title: “Never Again!”
Reviews.Author: Funnyscunny
Reviews.Content: Hotel clean n tidy, staff helpful and approachable, location good....but oh...The Bloody NOISE!...two night stay and only got about two hours sleep....If you do go, be sure to take some ear plugs!

Reviews.Title: “Great location and ideal if on a tight budget.”
Reviews.Author: RRDazzle
Reviews.Content: My fiancee and I stayed here for two nights earlier this month and found it decent value. The room was clean and had the basics you'd expect, nothing more and nothing less. The bed wasn't the most comfortable and the shower not fantastic but if you are on a tight budget and looking for something which is convenient for travel in London then it's ideal.

Reviews.Title: “Incredibly loud and worrying note in log book!”
Reviews.Author: Pres1
Reviews.Content: Surely if their was an award for the loudest hotel in London then this would be it. My room at the front of the hotel was just incredibly loud. Sleep was virtually impossible and it was like being in the middle of a traffic island for the night. Glazed windows may lead to some repeat business! One evening I asked reception to book me a taxi which they did for 7.30 the next morning. At 7.35 the lady behind reception looked at me curiously when I asked if she could call to see where the taxi was. She said she could call me a new one but it would take 20 minutes. I said that they had booked one the night before and pointed to the entry in her log book. She just looked at me blankly and repeated the offer to book one for 20 minutes time. I couldn't get anywhere with her and decided to take my chances on the street. When pointing at the entry in the log book I noticed the entry 'Rat spotted on 2nd floor!'. Needless to say I won't be staying there again........

Reviews.Title: “Very Very basic”
Reviews.Author: helsenhelsen
Reviews.Content: Booked 2 rooms, one was on the side where you can hear the trains etc - this is very noisy with the window closed, the other on the opposite side was quieter. The rooms are VERY basic. I have stayed in many travelodges and this is by far the worse. People may say "you get what you pay for" but at Â£100 per room you would want more. We stayed for a couple of hours (had just come back from a long flight) but decided to get a train home instead so checked out. The location is great for Kings Cross but is not worth Â£100 per room. Luckily we booked one room when it was on offer earlier in the year at around Â£22. The other room, we paid full price for. If you pay the cheap price then I spose you cant really grumble, but at the high end price, not worth it !!

Reviews.Title: “grim grim grim”
Reviews.Author: boothy22
Reviews.Content: i can not warn people enough about this so called hotel it was like staying in an old youth hostel we arrrived at two oclock and where told to sit in the bar which was not open till 3 oclock even though it stated we could book in a two.Three oclock came around and there was a mad stampead to book in with no thought for who had turned up first eventually due to slow computers the rooms where given to us and i cant tell you how bad the rooms where the windows where broken the walls where black there was a big whole under the bed the carpets where thread bare and the bathroom was grim.We made the best of it and stayed out as much as possible the toilets in reception had broken taps and no toilet paper and if you wanted a drink from the bars drink it fast before 12 because they put the air con on full blast at last orders so you dont sit down there the staff are rude and you have to explain everything twice due to poor english i was ashamed to say this is what we have to offer to are tourists in london.The next thing breakfast we paid for it but there is nowhere to eat it unless you want to wait 1 hour for your breakfast I havent mentioned about the broken lifts and plaster falling of the walls on the stairwells the black cab driver was laughing when he heard where we where staying there asking if we had seen any mice so that explains the hole in the carpet under the bed ! AVOID THIS HOTEL and hang your head in shame travellodge.

Reviews.Title: “disapointed”
Reviews.Author: sparky003
Reviews.Content: booked disabled room, got double bed!!! did not expect that in disabled, only one towel for 2 people, curtain rails broken on every window, we were on 1st floor above a railway line ( trains ran all night and came under us at one side and out at other ) club/bar below window ( st. chads ) noisy until midnight but wedding party until 5am on sat night we stayed, noise of music was terrible,got quiet at 5am and just dozed off when large sunlight laundry truck roared up bleepers blaring to deliver laundry, banging doors and pushing trolleys on roads.couldnt even come back through day for nap to catch up, trains came every 30 seconds. the rest of hotel was probably ok, we were just unlucky in choice of room, but i think management of travelodge should look into offering this room to disabled guests, who clearly are not going to be out all night and a peaceful room is part of their holiday.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly surprised - underated accomodation !”
Reviews.Author: Man0601
Reviews.Content: TIP: Phone a few days before your stay and ask for a 'quiet room' !!! We booked the travelodge as we were due to come back in late to Kings Cross from the Eurostar and needed somewhere convenient and close by to stay. There were 3 adults, one child and one young toddler in our party and once I had booked, I then read most of the reviews and then panicked! We all prepared ourselves for a bad night of noise and uncomfortable beds. However, I phoned 3 days before hand and confirmed we needed a travel cot and a quiet room to which the staff confirmed this would be sorted for us. We arrived late at night with two very grumpy kids. What a nice suprise we got when we arrived. The travel cot was all set up, the room was basic but clean and it was right at the end of the corridor at the back of the hotel so was very quiet (the occassional train sound, a police/ambulance siren or two and a few uncouth and inconciderate people coming in late who made a noise but that was it) The only grumble was that the bathroom door wouldn't close with the toilet lid down. Our child had to share our double bed with us but even then there was enough room. For the location, price and the fact that they let 3 adults share a room (rather than have to get another room), we couldn't fault the place.

Reviews.Title: “It isn't a Hotel so DON'T expect hotel standard.”
Reviews.Author: HDowney
Reviews.Content: They say you get what you pay for and where this Travelodge is concerned that is certainly true (although you can easily pay quite a bit to stay here - I did. Try to get an offer if you can). When we arrived the woman on reception was less than thrilled with the fact that we wanted both a twin room (which I booked a few months in advance - paying extra for early check in) and a quiet room (which I had rung ahead and asked for). I got the impression that as far as she was concerned I could have one or the other but not both. I got both tho. My room was downstairs but there was no lift so I had to lug my suitcase down them (and back up to leave). The room was adequately clean and tidy. It had tea and coffee facilities although the cups and kettle provided did not look the best of cleanlieness so we boiled and washed a couple times before using. All bar one day they provided two sets of towels and when we asked for a second set we were given them. One massive problem I had was with my quiet room. I can sleep through more noise than my friend so it would have been ok for me. But he needed to shut the window to get a decent nights sleep (trains were not the problem. It was ambulances, fire trucks, police cars, people etc). However as this Travelodge is in an old building there is no central heating/air conditioning which in 21 degree made things rather warm. I think there must be a way to install such even in an old building. I didn't try the breakfast or the bar (there was an abundance of places to eat in the vicinity) so I can't comment on these. I also didn't use the wifi as I thought it was rather expensive. There are computers in the lobby which cost Â£1 for 20 minutes which my friend used. The location was quite central to everywhere we wanted to go so this was good. Overall it was what I was expecting from my a traveloge. If you are wanting a hotel, book into a hotel. I can't overly complain. It was a place to sleep and shower and it did the job.

Reviews.Title: “DON'T FORGET THE EAR PLUGS”
Reviews.Author: NEIL49
Reviews.Content: Have just come back from 2 njghtsstaying here as part of show and stay package - great for insomniacs as you will be awake all night anyway, constant noise outside,rooms like a sauna but had to keep the windows shut becauseof noise. Reception staff obviously still going through training, customer service skills must be the last part of the course. When they did not seem to know what they were doing they just blamed the slow computer. Arrived 2 hours early but allowed to check in if I was willing to pay Â£10, so obviously the room was ready but because my booking form had a specific time on it I had to stick to it unless I stumped up. Â£5 to leave luggage as an alternative if wanted to wander around before checking in. Cheap is what it is, and cheap and noisy is what you get.

Reviews.Title: “Don't listen to the reviews - had a great stay”
Reviews.Author: Kez2u
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the hotel for three nights. Was a bit worried about the reviews and about the noise. Our room was clean and fresh with plenty of towels etc. It was very warm when we arrived so had to sleep with the window open which was fine and no noise was heard from the trains at all. We opted not to have breakfast at the hotel as there are plenty of shops and cafes round about but had drinks in the bar/restaurant which was nice and relaxed. All in all I would say I was pleasantly surprised at this hotel after reading the reviews and would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Expensive WiFi, No Sleep because of Trains, and average breakfast.”
Reviews.Author: city2surfer1961
Reviews.Content: My wife and daughter and I booked this hotel for its price and location. We were arriving on an evening flight from St Petersburg and wanted somewhere central. The room was Ok, nothing special, and it was clean, however sleep is almost impossible in this hotel as you are above the train line and can hear every train go past. One thing that shocked me was the price of wifi, we had just spent four weeks in Europe and had been accustomed to free wifi where we stayed, however this hotel wanted 5 pounds for an hour or 10 pounds for 24 hours !!! ridiculously expensive, however after this hotel we stayed at another in London and they wanted 12 pounds for a day. The other disappointing thing was breakfast, the dining room is too small and was very crowded. The quality of the food was very average, coming from Europe, where breakfasts were a delight and the food was fresh, the croisants were stale and the coffee was very bland. I know you get what you pay for, and we chose this place because it was cheap. My advice if you want to stay here, wear earplugs for sleeping, find a pub or cafe that has free wifi and do not eat at the hotel, other than that it was fine.

Reviews.Title: “Would NEVER recommend this Travelodge.”
Reviews.Author: slappymarine
Reviews.Content: I stayed in Travelodge's on numerous occasions and this one is the worst one I've ever used. 1. The guest toilet downstairs (gents), never had toilet rolls in it. 2. Bedroom had 3 single beds for a twin room so no space, no bedside cabinet, no chair and no waste bin. 3. Has 3 lifts, only 1 was working considering that this hotel had so many rooms. 4. Bathroom: cracked sink, mould on tile grout, bin lid doesn't open, no toilet roll holder (did have holes in the wall though) and no working light above the sink to see properly to shave (reported to reception but after 3 days, it was never dealt with). 5. Bathroom had no toilet rolls and 1 towel for 2 people, had to go downstairs to get some. 6. Only had 2 coat hangers so had nowhere to hang shirts or trousers. 7. Restaurant (breakfast) didn't have enough chairs to sit on, had to wait for someone to leave in order to get a chair. 8. Very noisy hotel, if you like your sleep, go elsewhere. All in all, I would never use this hotel again, and will certainly NEVER recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Noisiest Hotel I've Ever Stayed In”
Reviews.Author: richcase
Reviews.Content: Do not stay in this hotel if you want to get some sleep. The noise was terrible.

Reviews.Title: “Do not under any circumstances stay here”
Reviews.Author: annoyedattravelodge
Reviews.Content: Firstly my room was in what can only be described as the basement of the hotel so after going in a lift that looked like a mass murder had occured in it and trekking down the two flights of stairs (with suitcase) on a boiling hot night I was less than pleased to find out that I had no towels in my room and that the front door to the room rattled so much it sounded like my 86 year old grandma could have broken it down! I went to get in to bed to discover the sheets had obviously not been changed and were absolutely filthy! I went to reception to ask them to change my sheets and get towels and while I was chatting to the girl she told me she had so many complaints about the state of the hotel and that she'd never heard a good word said about it! I got to my second room (this was about 11pm) and there was no air conditioning and the windows only opened a crack which was obviously so I didn't jump out of the window (I was on the ground floor!) The T.V didn't work and the towels I was given smelt so strongly of fake tan I was convinced Jordan was in the room with me! All in all a rubbish experience and one I will never repeat! If I could give this Travelodge -5 stars I would!

Reviews.Title: “No, don't do it, please.....don't do it!”
Reviews.Author: Goiridh1
Reviews.Content: Although this traveloge is very cheap for London, please, please, please, if you have any spare change in your pocket spend it on something a little better. This place is truly dreadful. Travelodge is generally pretty good for a reasonably priced overnighter but this is a shame to the brand. Check in - pretty unfriendly but not that bad. Room - shabby, dirty, plenty of hot water in the bathroom, in fact so hot that it was unusable without risking burns, no cold water!! Window wouldn't close so VERY noisy all night. Curtain filthy and curtain rail broken so the curtain hanging down. Thankfully I was able to close it by hanging a ripped piece of material over a rusty nail in the wall. Graffiti in corridors, but in such a hole can you blame them! Filthy lifts & broken vending machines. Breakfast - don't bother! A chaotic mess made worse by a truly evil manageress. As a welcome she shouts 'IN' at you as she throws cutlery at you. One elderly tourist tot he UK who looked uspet by the chaos was nastily told 'well if you don't want to put up with this you should have got up at 7am shouldn't you!" The manageress also insisted in shouting at a couple of poor young teenage girls who didn't understand that they needed a voucher to eat...they clearly didn't speak English so simply shouting louder won't help! This staff member wasnâ€™t British thank God...that would make me really ashamed in front of all the foreign visitors! There were no tables available so people were wandering around with plates of food looking for somewhere to sit and eat....go to the nearest cafe please!! This place is truly dreadful, it's a scar on Travelodge, London and the UK. Don't do it if you can avoid it.....you have been warned.

Reviews.Title: “Can get better deals elsewhere”
Reviews.Author: YorkshireRA
Reviews.Content: Paid Â£96.00 for 1 night on Saturday. No airconditioning, windows only open ajar so very hot. Didn't experience the noise people say but was out all saturday night, wrecked and maybe the tube wasn't working on the Sunday morning as there was alot of engineering work. For the price paid, I would recommend spending a little more and stopping at Russell Square which is only one stop away on Picadilly line.

Reviews.Title: “The noise and heat were absolutely unbelievable”
Reviews.Author: thehappywandererUk
Reviews.Content: Do not stay here. It may be cheap compared to other hotels in the area but you will not get more than 4-5 hours sleep each night. Trains go past the hotel constantly, the large windows (which only open an inch or so) and lack of air-con mean that the temperature in the rooms is unbearable after about 7am. The fact that the windows have to stay open in order to avoid being cooked alive obviously doesn't help with the noise. I can not emphasis enough just how much of a problem the heat in the room was. The staff were not terribly nice and were quite rude to a woman who had just lost money in one of the vending machines in reception. The bedclothes had a disgusting, stagnant water-ish smell coming from them. The bed was comfortable otherwise. Just don't breathe through your nose while trying to get to sleep... Overall, there is little to like about this place. It is near good transport links but if you're hoping to get any good quality sleep while in London, go elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Noisy and no frills seems to mean unhelpful. Avoid unless you sleep like the dead.”
Reviews.Author: Chalmers30
Reviews.Content: This is the second time we have stayed here for convenience of location. The big problem here is that many rooms are right next to tube and train tracks which finish at about 1am and start again at 5.30ish. Why repeat it you say? Well the first time was a cool Spring weekend so the trains started later and we had the windows tight shut (just a little difference to noise) but second time was a very warm june evening mid-week and the train noise went on later and started earlier (including loudspeaker announcements from the depot after trains stopped) was incredibly loud. The room is so basic that only soap is provided and we were two people with one set of towels but no roomphone to call down for another set when needed (weren't really in a position to trot down to reception to ask for them!). Infuriatingly too, we arrived at 1445 with checkin due from 1500 - and along with others had to wait until exactly 1500 to check in - jobsworth or what?? Finally, yes, Travelodge prides itself on not including frills to make it cheaper - but we weren't paying just Â£19 per night but it seems you all get treated the same whether or not you are on a bargain price. Avoid unless you're stuck at Kings X late at night and have no choice.

Reviews.Title: “Noisy”
Reviews.Author: nowtas
Reviews.Content: I had a room facing the train tracks and, realistically, more could be done by the hotel to block out some of the noise â€“ but I appreciate those who end up in such rooms would find them a bit noisy even if the windows were bricked up! Other than, this is a fair hotel. Rooms and hallways were clean, staff polite, and everything in the room was acceptable. Nothing great then but I've certainly stayed in worse over the years. It has been a while (over two years) since I stayed at the nearby Travelodge London Farringdon, but that was in better condition and less noisy â€“ Iâ€™d suggest going for that unless (as was the case when I chose between them this time around) the difference in price for the required stay is notable.

Reviews.Title: “Basic clean and good value- a short walk to the Eurostar”
Reviews.Author: Wiganrover
Reviews.Content: We stayed before getting the Eurostar room was quite small no bath in the family room but it was clean. Breakfast was basic but cereals and toast with half decent coffee were OK. It was great value just Â£22 per night booked well in advance.

Reviews.AuthorLocation: Peak District National Park, United Kingdom
Reviews.Title: “Not great”
Reviews.Author: MissTigerFish
Reviews.Content: The only positive we had was the hotel's location. Across from Kings Cross and St Pancras, it was perfect for our early morning train to Paris. Now the negatives; we paid around Â£95 for the double room. The room was a long walk from reception through awkward corridors and small steps (not good with large bags). The room was almost under ground, through the small window we could see people's legs walking past, and cars. The bathoom was.... grimey (the sticky feeling you get when things are cleaned with a dirty cloth). The receptionist to her credit did enquire if we had a pleasant stay on check out - sadly she didnt seem to listen to our response.

Reviews.Title: “Just arrived home and went straight to bed...”
Reviews.Author: marypopSheffield
Reviews.Content: Prices start at Â£19... we paid Â£106 for a one night stay. The room itself was basic but clean, and spacious enough. However, all this was pretty irrelevant as the main purpose of the stay was to sleep - which didn't happen... The website does warn of train noise from nearby Kings Cross, but not of the ill-fitting double glazing which did nothing to prevent said noise from penetrating the room. Nor did the website warn of the 24 hour bar directly behind the hotel which continued to render me sleepless long after the trains had stopped running. We didn't stop to try out the breakfast...

Reviews.Title: “Basic but very convenient”
Reviews.Author: Talulab3lle
Reviews.Content: After reading reviews on here I was really worried about what to expect but was pleasantly suprised! The building itself is beautiful and literally two minutes from Kings Cross station (once you're over the crossings that is). The staff werent overly friendly but certainly werent rude either. I got extra pillows immediately I asked for them. The room was basic but clean and the bed was really comfy. I was a bit concerned about the lack of tv channels available but as we werent actually in the room for very long it really wasnt a problem. The reviews on here had mentioned the noise at the front of the building so I specifically asked for a room not facing the main street. The only real complaint I have is that I was woken during the night by a high pitched noise which was causing the surfaces in the room to vibrate a bit. It wasnt too loud and I got back off to sleep straight away but it was a bit strange. Can only guess it was the heating or something.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap but not so cheerful”
Reviews.Author: seagull6
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 1 night whilst on a business trip.Hotel within easy walking distance of the station and I guess thats where the problem lies. Despite booking a twin room we were given a double (2 females fortunately) and the train noise is indescribable (not warned about that on check in) O.K. for just 1 night as we only spent about 8 hours in the room but any longer would have driven me insane.Have to say tho it was clean but toiletries in the bathroom are 1 small bar of soap and that's it.Would I stay again ? That's a definate NO.

Reviews.Title: “Worst Hotel I have ever booked”
Reviews.Author: WideTraveller777
Reviews.Content: This was as the subject states, the Worst Hotel I have ever booked Bad Points 1. No lugagge storage 2. rude receptionists, who couldnt speak english and couldnt look at a customer 3. no guidance about the hotel when checking in 4. no directions to the bedroom (also no help to 4 elderly guests who had to walk 4 flights of stairs because housekeeping were using the lift on the 3rd floor therefore taking it out of action for guests) 5. Poor bedroom 6. window broken in the room, no handle, no way of closing it, therefore room freezing 7. no phone in the room 8. very little toilet paper 9. toilet positioned so close to the wall like most cheap bad hotels Much like the photos pictured by a fellow guest from Canada I to have been bitten on my arm and on my back

Reviews.Title: “Perfect night's sleep, stone's throw from Kings X Station, great!”
Reviews.Author: LukewarmCatastrophe
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very easy to find. Upon leaving Kings Cross station, bear left and head towards the traffic lights. Look into the distance along Grays Inn Road and you can't miss it. It is literally a 3-4 minute walk across the road. Upon the advice of other Tripadvisor reviewers, I called ahead a day in advance and spoke to Monique on reception to request a quiet room. This was swiftly done and Monique said "see you tomorrow" which was a nice touch. Good start! When we arrived, the reception staff were friendly and welcoming. We checked into our room which was Room 128 on the first floor. We had a view which seemed to look out onto an inner courtyard and the other side of the hotel so we got some natural light in the room which we weren't expecting! I noticed immediately that the room was very hot. It was a very warm and sunny spring day in London and we'd just had a walk around the city, and were tired, so I attributed it to that, but I made a point of looking at the heater on the wall just in case and it was switched on. I left it as I presumed it would be cold by the time we got home that evening! The room was surprisingly spacious, the bedsheets were crisp and clean, only one pillow each (a spare was provided in the wardrobe space if required - it wasn't), there was hanging space with coathangers, and a large desk area. The bathroom was fairly small, but perfectly functional and spotlessly clean. The shower was powerful and hot although the head was in a stationary position on the wall and was not removable/adjustable. Again, thanks to the advice of previous Tripadvisor reviewers, I checked the number of towels on the rail and there was only one large bathsheet and one hand towel. Not enough for my partner and I, so I made sure I requested an extra towel in advance and this wasn't a problem. I would also say they were a bit stingy with the toilet paper - we had enough - just - but it literally ran out as we were checking out, so I'll knock them down half a mark for that too. We paid Â£35 for the room on a Sunday evening, booking through the official website 2-3 months or so in advance and for Central London, this really is exceptional. We only needed somewhere to get our head down for the night/shower in the morning after a concert and this not only met all of our requirements but actually exceeded them. I actually had a completely uninterrupted night's sleep, and for a hotel this close to a major railway station, I find that incredible. I didn't hear a door slam all night, I didn't hear another guest, and I certainly didn't hear a train or a wailing siren. Nor did the room shake, so take other reviews with a pinch of salt. I would not hesitate in staying here again, especially if I could get a good deal.

Reviews.Title: “Really awful hotel”
Reviews.Author: PaulaBraga
Reviews.Content: I didn't like this hotel at all. Rude staff. Bad rooms. Noisy. The lift was almost always out of order. Choose another hotel. The employee in charge MACALI was very very rude.

Reviews.Title: “Don't be put off by bad reviews ....... Good location, spotless room”
Reviews.Author: TeeMan11
Reviews.Content: After reading the reviews of this hotel, we were fully expecting to check-in .... then check-out to somewhere else. On arrival we were pleasantly suprised by the hotel, not the Ritz but the reception was clean and bright. The room was fine, 100 times better than expected. It was spotlessly clean, quiet with a really comfy bed and powerful shower. The location was also very good, far enough from King's Cross to avoid the endless whail of police sirens and about a 10 minute walk to the station/Tube. Plenty of decent pubs close-by with lots of eateries/cafes (which we didn't sample). After working in London for years, staying in 5-star hotels to guest houses, I wouldn't hesitate to use this hotel again ..... It was definitely one of the cleanest rooms I've ever had! The total cost for 2 nights was Â£50.00, booked in advance with a no-refund policy .... BARGAIN. Finally, a big thumbs up to the staff ....... No real need to speak to them, other than at check-in ....... But when we did, they were polite, helpful and friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Good connection to the London town”
Reviews.Author: maximinimum
Reviews.Content: I stayed there twice, once was with my family and the other was with my boyfriend. Their triple room I stayed was relatively very small, with three narrow single beds and so as the double room. However, its access to the town is fantastic. It's very close to the King's Cross / St Pancras station and you can go anywhere you want. There are so many bus connections as well. I haven't eaten breakfast there so i cant judge but it was good to eat sandwiches or buns at the cafe across the hotel. it's a shame the chain recently stopped Â£19 sale for London hotels. It was a great value to stay there with minimum price.

Reviews.Title: “AVOID AT ALL COSTS”
Reviews.Author: WorcsHornet
Reviews.Content: All we wanted was somewhere to sleep after 2 full days of sightseeing and the location to Kings X seemed perfect and at just over 50.00 for 3 of us for 2 nights it seemed a bargain. BUT do not be fooled. We appreciate they are a no frills hotel , no toiletries , extra pillows and towels on request but tea and coffee in room. We couldnt get 3 of us in the room , there were 3 small single beds bunched up against 1 wall and explicably a drawer blocking our entrance. We soon established the drawer had fallen out of a wonky set of drawers and that coupled with the beds blocking the door we needed to re-organise the room. The drawer we put back into the broken unit holding the TV up and moved the beds against one wall. We were then all 3 of us able to enter the room. Yes the bed linen was clean BUT the room was filthy the carpet edges hadnt been hoovered and under the " dresser " was a dirty sock , tissue paper and general dirt. Two of the lights didnt work , the kettle had no lead and there were only 2 mugs. This was reported to reception who delivered a new lead, a plastic mug ? and the promise of an electrician to fix the lights. The lights never were mended and we never got a proper mug. The " we only need a bed for the night " was a joke as we hardly slept! The noise up until 3am and again at 6am was incredible. We had a great weekends sightseeing BUT this was completely ruined by staying at this hotel. PLEASE pay a little more and stay elsewhere

Reviews.Title: “hotel kazachstan”
Reviews.Author: superrab101
Reviews.Content: absolute tip of a hotel,terrible decor,lifts stink of smoke, rooms not cleaned regularly.never again!

Reviews.Title: “great value hotel for london”
Reviews.Author: aussie196360
Reviews.Content: we are from Australia and stayed at the travelogue in kings cross it was very clean great price very basic but that's all you need when you are in London your out all day they have a great continental breakfast very reasonable price and the kids eat free highly recommended great location 2 min fro tube station

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: jackomonkey
Reviews.Content: This hotel is well positioned, and near good transport links. 30 minute walk to Oxford Street.

Reviews.Title: “Damned Convenient”
Reviews.Author: MiddleAgeAussie
Reviews.Content: Let me throw my two bobs worth into this debate. If you stumble from an intercity train - as we did - and you're looking for a place to crash, then look no more. It's just too damned convenient, literally across the road from Kings Cross station. Our room ought to have been dreadfully noisy since it was perched on the first floor overlooking a fairly busy intersection, however, we were not unduly disturbed by occasional labourings of early morning buses. The room itself was adequate and clean. As you should know Travelodge eschews the offering oc complimentary toiletries - so don't whinge about that. And don't bother with breakfast at any Travelodge; you'll find better value and better fare outside. Hotels are where one sleeps. Restaurants are where one eats. I rarely complain when my favouite pizzaria fails to provode me with a king size posture-paedic sleeping ensemble. And whilst talking aout pizzarias, there is, diagonally opposite the hotel, a most delightful and inexpensive establishment of that ilk - I must look up its name. We were directed towards this culinary find by the charming young lady who checked us into our room at the Travelodge. This 3 star, 5 star nonsense is quite ridiculous. London is a 5 star city - in which t/lodge provided us a clean, safe and comfortable bed at a reasonable price.

Reviews.Title: “Reasonable for overnight before catching Eurostar.”
Reviews.Author: ruthiejane
Reviews.Content: This Travelodge is close to Kings Cross station, London. We stayed one night before catching a Eurostar from St Pancras early the following morning. We booked online several months in advance and paid Â£49 for a double room, more than we would usually pay for a Travelodge, but this was central London. We were offered breakfast when we checked in but declined as we were leaving so early. I thought that the building was the nicest Travelodge we have ever seen. The receptionist told us that it was old housing offices. This conversion did however mean that our room was on the fifth floor, and the lift only went to the fourth floor, we then had to walk up some very windy stairs and narrow corridors to reach our room. Part of the charm for me, but could be difficult for anyone not so steady on their feet. Only one of the two lifts was working. There was a coffee machine in the lobby area but it was marked out of service. When we returned to the hotel later in the evening there was a drunk sitting in the doorway which was a bit off-putting, but I can understand why the very young staff on reception would not want to try to do anything. The room only had a shower rather than the usual shower over a bath I expect in Travelodges. There were towels provided as well as a small bar of soap, and plastic "glasses". We had a double room, which has one double bed, and a sofa bed. There was a television, which worked. The room was spotlessly clean, and very quiet for inner city London. The following morning we walked the five minutes to St Pancras station and found several places along the way to get croissants and other breakfast items for a fraction of the price of a prepacked breakfast box from Travelodge. I would go back to this hotel for a one night stop due to the cleanliness, price and convenient location. For a longer stop I would want to find a hotel with more facilities.

Reviews.Title: “Absolute Rubbish!”
Reviews.Author: GCaceres
Reviews.Content: Room was horrible, breakfast was a joke and the overall service of the hotel could definitely be improved on. My suggestion would be to seek other accommodation, even if it means paying a little more.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth your money”
Reviews.Author: peterams
Reviews.Content: This hotel stunts with prices as for 19 pounds per night. Extra'10 pounds for early check in (12.00!) and late checkout (12.00 again). Breakfast is below standard, no toast because of fire regulations!!!!! No shampoo in the room only 1 tiny soapbar. We payed 90 pounds per night and had to buy ouw own shampoo. Staff very unhelpful and unfriendly. The Travelodge chain in the US is simple but you have a good deal with them. Travelodge England will never have the joy of seeing us again

Reviews.Title: “shocking room, poor service not worth the money dont stay there”
Reviews.Author: ejl1972
Reviews.Content: had to stay overnight and this seemed reasonable, I'd stayed there a very long time ago and it was ok then, completely different now, I arrived quite late to be greeted by a non talkative staff member who didnt smile and just recited the rules to me next I went up to the room and it was awful, the surfaces hadnt been wiped the sink and loo looked horrible but I just needed somewhere to sleep as had to be up early anyway so went straight to bed. will not stay there again very disappointing, it needs refreshing with better staff and better cleaners.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely appalling, avoid at all costs”
Reviews.Author: vix92008
Reviews.Content: Located about 10 minutes walk from Euston station to the West in an unpleasant location where you would not want to walk along the street on your own at night. The rooms were booked by a course provider for our party so we had no choice in the matter. When we checked in there was only one quiet room left so the rest of the party were told 'Its says on the web site, you accept this at the time you book' Reception was not clean and was shabby with roller shutters to protect the staff. You are issued a key card upon check in that you need to pass through all the doors and to use the lift to protect residents from the undesirable element in the locale. Reception is closed at night. My room had a window that opened inwards as it opened over the Kings Cross tube/Thameslink lines. Mugs were dirty, no complimentary shampoo, no air con and heaters took a long time to get warm. No hair dryer or iron/ironing board. I went back to reception to 'borrow' a hairdryer to be told both (2 hairdryers for rooms) had been loaned out. Waited 20 minutes for a hairdryer to be found from lost property for me. Railway was noisy until 1am with trains, then maintenance until 5am at which point the trains started again. Due to the budget nature there were lots of guests who were not in the hotel for the same purpose as we were (sleep!) and running in the corridors until 2am, then what sounded like jumping on and off beds until 3:20am. No reception to complain to during these hours. If this had been a cheap deal it wouldnt have been so bad but at over Â£90 per person it was only a few pounds off the price of far superior hotels in nicer locations.

Reviews.Title: “Not as bad as expected given some of the reviews!”
Reviews.Author: EmmaM2006
Reviews.Content: I was unable to find a hotel in our price bracket in the Kings Cross area that had consistently good reviews on Trip Advisor and so was apprehensive about our stay at Travelodge. However, other than not having our room ready for early check-in (which we had previously arranged and paid for), I have no complaints. The staff were somewhat unwelcoming, although not actually impolite. They rectified the problem with early check-in fairly quickly and efficiently. The room was fine and the location pretty good.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent, helpful staff and clean”
Reviews.Author: mrspinkrat70
Reviews.Content: A cut above the usual Travelodge mainly due to it's very pleasant, professional staff and location. The building itself is impressive, the staff more than helpful, the rooms clean and the area is really vibrant. The hotel itself is just a stones throw away from the stations. All-in-all, great value for money.

Reviews.Title: “DIRTY AND FLEA INFESTED”
Reviews.Author: KAW4444
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Travelodge because we thought there would be set standards as advertised on TV, how wrong we were. The room was appalling; dirty bedding, furniture and tea making facilities. Staff were rude, unpleasent and not willing to help at all. During our stay we were horrified to discover flea bites! we would not recommend any of our relatives or friends to stay at travelodge accomadation. AS FOR THE ABOVE RATING IF I HAD A CHOICE I WOULD GIVE IT ZERO!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “doesn't deserve bad reviews”
Reviews.Author: richcraft
Reviews.Content: Just wanted to redress the balance of reviews about this travelodge! Some are so bad that I was seriously considering cancelling our booking but am very glad i did not! My husband, 18yr old son and I stayed here this week and found it very good value for money, clean, the reception staff were polite and friendly, our missing bath plug was replaced within 10 minutes!, and although we were at the front of the hotel (admittedly in the basement, room 2) we did not hear all the train noise that people have referred to in past reviews nor were we disturbed by undue traffic noise! The room was very large compared to other travelodges we have stayed in and the facilities just as you would expect. There was a musty smell in the hallway which was initially worrying but this did not continue into the room itself. All in all a very convenient and satisfactory base for our trip.

Reviews.Title: “never again”
Reviews.Author: angelaherron5
Reviews.Content: dirty room strange marks on carpet!!! very noisy, very small, locked windows no ventilation.

Reviews.Title: “is the train in my room!”
Reviews.Author: Padraicd
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel because my friend was staying here. Oh my God! never never never again. The room vibrated with the train going past. During the day we counted trains every 15 seconds! This hotel do not do twin rooms which I only discovered when I checked in. I traveled with my 15 year old son. They offered to put a matress on the floor for him , not a full tempory bed but a matress!. I never checked tripadvisor before I left but I feel I have to let people know no matter if its value or not this is a dreadful place. When I complained the staff member did say if I asked for a quieter room they would have given it to me but they were fully booked. I booked the room 2 months b4 i left so this just left me thinking the fool didnt ask 2 months b4 so let her stay in the room that shakes every time a train goes by....its kings cross !!! busy busy station

Reviews.Title: “Great Location but noisy with Trains”
Reviews.Author: AngusAsh
Reviews.Content: There are 2 Travelodges at Kings Cross. This one is literally across the road from the station. The Royal Scot is a 10 minute walk away. The hotel is fine and the only problem or concern is the railway line. I had read the comments on Trip Advisor before going so asked for a quiet room at check in. This had not been possible as they were all out. The hotel has an extension at the back which is almost on top of the Thamselink Line AND the Circle/District Line of the London Underground. Trains quieten down after 1.00am and start up again around 5.00am. Otherwise this is a basic hotel in the centre of London within walking distance of Kings Cross. We took the advice of the previous people who recommended Da Vinci's Italian Cafe at 323 Gray's Inn Road (across the road from the Travelodge towards the station). This offers a wide choice of breakfast at a reasonable price with a comfortable surroundings and would definitely pass on this option to anyone else.

Reviews.Title: “You pays cheap - you gets cheap!!”
Reviews.Author: York_TravellerYork
Reviews.Content: Excellent location. I could slag this tired and somewhat subpar hotel all day long, but the fact is I paid Â£29 for a family room next to Kings Cross and for this reason I would recommend it if you can get a really cheap deal. An example of why Travelodge are generally a hotel chain to be avoided - for breakfast no toaster available, and no microwave to heat up milk. They told me this was because of grade 2 building planing restrictions!!. No fresh fruit, stale croissants etc etc. But only Â£9.95 breakfast cost for 5 of us! - you see the pattern here. Not good, but cheap enough to make you want it. Overall, fairly clean, cheap and great great location for a hotel that wouldn't get any business otherwise.

Reviews.Title: “Dirty, dirty, dirty hotel”
Reviews.Author: larubains
Reviews.Content: The worse hotel I ever stayed. Stay away from it. The management forgot the meaning of the word "clean". Because every inch of this hotel is dirty.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, good location, secure & Inexpensive”
Reviews.Author: travelingstudent66
Reviews.Content: Clean as expected from Travelodge. Although swipe card keys annoy some people it does mean the hotel is secure. The location is great for sightseeing London as as from Kings Cross you can get tube to a lot of places without changing lines. This coupled with the Oyster card makes travel from Kings Cross around London easy. Other chain hotels do not offer costs anywhere near this cheap. For individual hotels you are not assured of the cleanliness, security or room size for the cost of travelodge. Staff were friendly but as with all Travelodges you do not have much contact with them. Would definitly use again and recommend. Do ask for a quite room when booking.

Reviews.Title: “No Frills is the Order of the day”
Reviews.Author: EastofHampstead
Reviews.Content: Had to go for a medical procedure at a nearby hospital, so the wife and I stayed here for two nights. Seemed to be the cheapest hotel in the area - We would have preferred to have stayed at the Premier Travel Inn but it was at least Â£70 dearer so we opted for the Travelodge instead. No Frills was definitely the order of the day for this hotel. "The Hotel Revolution starts here" it says on the website! Perhaps they are referring to an austere soviet style Russian revolution? The staff were efficient enough if a little bit sullen. As we all know good manners costs nothing (unless you happen to work for the Travelodge!) or maybe it's more on the cold war theme..... Much like the New Labour vision for Britain you seem to need your key-card for everything: Getting into the building, using the lift, getting through adjoining doors. We asked for a quiet room and were given one facing into the inner quadrant. We weren't disturbed by rail or traffic noise. The room was clean and functional but there is no phone. So expect to use your mobile if you have to ring reception. This is probably the cheapest hotel in the immediate area and fine if you want somewhere to crash for a night or two and the monastic frugality of the place doesn't bother you. Eating out - We ate at the "chop-chop noodle bar" opposite the station. Cheap and very tasty and also at â€œKitchenâ€� in Neals Yard. Kitchen is an all you can eat buffet themed around Thai, Indian, Chinese and er....Italian cuisine. Not sure that it really works as a concept but you can stuff your face till you burst!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value and location”
Reviews.Author: Stromata
Reviews.Content: Very clean room with effecient secondary glazing keeping out the traffic noise and only a short walk to St Pancras to catch an early Eurostar. The reception staff were polite and business like. This is by far the best Travelodge I have stayed in, although they are all generally good value for money. However, the only thing that lets these places down is the other guests! Why do people think it is funny and clever to come back to the hotel in the early hours after a night out shouting, screaming and banging doors etc etc?

Reviews.Title: “Okay for business stays - quiet if in right rooms”
Reviews.Author: sbishop
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for one night. arriving late. Pleasant check-in staff. Room in basement and pretty small and dull. But faced backwards and quiet. Have been in better room on a previous short visit. No breakfast in the morning. Surrounding area not inviting, although okay if you know it.

Reviews.Title: “Does what it says on the tin!”
Reviews.Author: av0cet
Reviews.Content: Travelodges are basic so don't expect frills and take your own toiletires (they have to keep costs down somehow). Having read the helpful reviews here, I rang and asked for a quiet room and that was exactly what we got so we had no train/tannoy noise. Ours was a refurbished room so it was also well-decorated and clean. Breakfast basic but fine and good value.

Reviews.Title: “Good value”
Reviews.Author: D5Tweddle
Reviews.Content: Stayey here for 2 nights as it is very close to St Pancras International. Good location, lots of bars and restaurants near by. Reception was small, but friendly staff. Rooms were small but clean. Not very modern, but beds were comfortable. Can get noise from the Underground if you on that side, but did not wake us up. Braekfast room was the bar (that closes without telling anybody, and chucks you out when they want to go home) on the 1st floor. Breafast was good, a good supply of everything apart from a full engligh breakfast (no hot breakfast's - work that one out?) None of the staff are English though.
